[{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-01-29 23:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-01-29 23:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-01-30 09:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-01-30 09:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-02-01 11:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-05 08:57:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I was thinking about this, I wonder if we should consider a new validation in heat that can validate map values based on an allowed_pattern?

Probably not that hard, we'd apply the existing allowed_pattern validation in a loop to all values?

Not blocking just thinking how we could make this more robust"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-05 08:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/constraints.py#L579

Another possibility would be to extend the current allowed_types to work with list/map values and just document that it iterates over any collection if such a type is specified?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-29 13:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This patch has no activity for a while, per policy, we abandon it. Feel free to re-open if you think you're working on it."}]

commit_message:
libvirt-reproducer: use ansible_connection=local

Presently the user's own key needs to be added to authorized_users.

Since the --libvirt option is for localhost only, use the
'local' connection plugin.  This removes a common first point
of frustration for users and will avoid ssh entirely for the virthost
connection

Closes-Bug: #1769530
Change-Id: I7cafe0e4315cc6877e0e50ebfcc8e0f8307582d1

messages:
[{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2018-06-07 14:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-07 15:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Also not setting the fstype to xfs on these images'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-08 06:56:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't believe that this will work. Because we define the layout of our images in http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/tree/elements/overcloud-secure/block-device-default.yaml . So the global mkfs_opts is not taken.
The way to do it, is to modify that overcloud-secure element, and for each mkfs item, add the 'opts' setting there, that will be used for the mkfs command on each of the items."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-08 07:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

++ for yolanda's comment, in particular at [1] the --mkfs-opts option is merged only into the "mkfs_root" node for backwards compatibility purposes.

the idea was that when people moved to a specific block device config, like here, then the options would be specified directly in the config file as appropriate for each partition/fs

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/block_device/blockdevice.py#n175'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-29 13:44:51.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This patch has no activity for a while, per policy, we abandon it. Feel free to re-open if you think you're working on it."}]

commit_message:
Build all image filesystems with a 4k sector size

This will support both 512b and native 4k disks.

The overcloud-full images were altered in
I1e64647b3de86bc87a2a04cedf54ac83bbd4963d, but the non-default images were not.

Change-Id: I5f4566a53974ebbfc58a6709616c3ce7f7dd261f
Closes-Bug: #1746727

commit_message:
DMN: Testing tripleo-ci upgrade logic (sprint 14) (change2)

This is a no-op change to THT (master branch) used to create
a new THT rpm that needs to be injected during the upgrade/update
workflow

It depends on another change (also master, THT) to validate
the case where we have multiple patches on the same branch

This patch depends on:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572933 (tht, master)
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572736 (tqe)

Change-Id: I75b5481c5279c6e7c4017a184c8a21fe252a000a
Depends-On: I5abb4c202e86dabd57e9e5d412d23720d7f6e550
Context: https://trello.com/c/6tcD7ilr/778-injecting-zuul-changes-at-various-points-in-the-job-workflow

[{'created': '2018-06-13 07:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Limit curl operation to pull/push Swift rings to 120 seconds

This will limit the overall time for curl to 120 seconds. This should be
more than enough time for curl to push/pull rings (which are typically
less than a MiB in size on OOO). If this is not done within 120 seconds,
something is not working as expected and we don't want to block this for
much longer.

Related-Bug: 1776550
Change-Id: I171955069c5ad53979b60912a67ccd61ae0acf93
"}]
commit_message:
Limit curl operation to pull/push Swift rings to 120 seconds

This will limit the overall time for curl to 120 seconds. This should be
more than enough time for curl to push/pull rings (which are typically
less than a MiB in size on OOO). If this is not done within 120 seconds,
something is not working as expected and we don't want to block this for
much longer.

Related-Bug: 1776550
Change-Id: I171955069c5ad53979b60912a67ccd61ae0acf93

commit_message:
Add some Database and Messaging standalone example role definitions

Extend the number of possible architectures which are included in roles
directory with composable roles of standalone Database or Messaging role
and based on which roles_data.yaml file with standalone only Database
or Messaging (or both) roles could be generated by using "openstack
overcloud roles generate" command.

Change-Id: I3c08f3f5bb972e39faf77ce1f89c1a034be080e6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 16515, 'name': 'mbu', 'email': 'mat.bultel@gmail.com', 'username': 'matbu'}, {'_account_id': 21537, 'name': 'Yurii Prokulevych', 'email': 'yprokule@redhat.com', 'username': 'yprokule'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-04 20:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-04 20:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-06-05 06:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-05 06:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-06-05 08:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:15:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

you need to make a similar change to the code in tripleoclient since this script is no longer used on master.

it's at tripleoclient/workflows/deployment.py. I suggest a new CLI arg, --overcloud-admin."}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-05 11:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ack thank you James, I will do it.
I did this patch because some of the QE tests was using this script for Pike and Queens (OSP-12 && 13)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-06-07 07:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@James, I have made the required change in the cli as well.

I think we need both patch, since this script will be used in the previous releases, downstream in particular.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-06-14 10:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I don't see this as desirable... -2 for now to force some discussion, i'm willing to retract it if folks really think this is desirable, but i think we'd just be signing up for pain this way.

1) Once we allow user to customize this, we'll have to add inputs for providing this value all over TripleO. It affects CLI as James mentioned, but would affect UI too as it would have to remember what to pass to the mistral workflow.

2) It makes things more difficult for support folks, as they'd have to start dealing with more variance. (In a place where variance doesn't really bring any benefit IMO? In my view, this is something like giving the user a choice between "do you want to run nova-api as `nova` user or `theircustomnova` user -- i also wouldn't want to have that customizable.)

3) Why would an operator want to customize this in the first place? I don't think it's likely that they already have a tripleo-admin user which is being used for something else, and i can't think of a different reason. (?)

A side note for clarity:

Let's not confuse the tripleo-admin user with a user that operators use to ssh into the overcloud. Tripleo-admin is intended for automated TripleO tasks, while you'll still have different users for manual operator ssh usage. For Heat+Nova+Ironic envs this will likely still be heat-admin user, for deployed server envs it will be something fully custom name which they traditionally use on their servers. But all of those envs would converge on tripleo-admin for automated TripleO tasks. I don't think we should be giving up this dependable consistency without a very good reason to do so.

Feel free to ping me on IRC to discuss.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-29 13:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This patch has no activity for a while, per policy, we abandon it. Feel free to re-open if you think you're working on it."}]

commit_message:
Pass overcloud_admin to the deployed_srv admin creation

The workflow for creating the deployed server admin user
takes in param the overcloud_admin, which is set by default
to tripleo-admin.
This patch add to the scrip the possibility to change the
default value for the overcloud_admin user.

Change-Id: Ia776a27ef4f806240e3cdb1620f080d4331aac09

commit_message:
Add overcloud-admin-user option to the cli

This patch allow the user to specify the overcloud-admin-user
for the deployed server deployment.
It avoid to keep the hardcoded tripleo-admin one.

commit_message:
Add TRIPLEO_CI_ROOT variable

This change simplify the location of the tripleo-ci project by using
a single variable based on the toci_gate script location. This makes
it easier to run the script from a ci-defined location of the tripleo-ci
checkout.

Change-Id: I66859dbb2b8c9cbd438b61561ac50cb24f5cde92

commit_message:
Rename repos variable to nodepool_repos

'repos' is used by other roles, so overriding it is more complex than
it needs to be.

Change-Id: I18d96da0a1184388ac6624a0d7c47de3d0a2bd98

messages:
[{'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-06 11:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I dont understand how this does anything... if it finds the old repo, it backs it up, but then immediately deletes the backup. I think I must be missing something, but without a n -> n+1 CI job it is kind of hard to see how this would behave.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let's redesign the solution here..

When the gating repo is created, let's ensure it's created with the release name e.g. gating_queens.repo and gating_master.repo.

When the build-test-packages runs [1], the gating repo name should be set there w/ the branch included in the name.


install-built-repo should create the yum config appropriately also with branch name [2]

install-built-repo should disable all gating_$branch.repo files it finds. This can be done also around [2], then enable the gating_$release where release equals the release passed to quickstart.

This way we don't have to archive anything, or delete anything.  It's also more obvious which repo contains which patches.





[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/build-test-packages/tasks/main.yml#L163
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/install-built-repo/templates/install-built-repo.sh.j2#L8-L15"}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Wes @Trown played around with adding release to the gating repo tarball name, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572694/

But your idea is much better.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Wes, @Trown it has been tested with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571435/

It harcode a n -> n + 1, so we can test it before finish the other cards.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 08:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 08:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Wes @Trow This last patch is an implementation of adding release, I am testing it so will need more work.

Sorry for the previous brain fart patch set (it was being tested too).'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21686, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

Some questions / comments inline, mostly around the scenarios for multiple gating repos.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Few changes needed, but overall VERY NICE work!

Question:  to be sure only the appropriate gating repo was enabled we discussed disabling all $release_gate.repo files then explicitly enabling the appropriate release.  Where is that in this code?'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-08 12:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-08 12:17:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

@Wes the repo is disabled at install-built-repo/templates/install-built-repo.sh.j2 the top 'sed' command."}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-06-08 12:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Add release to gating repo

Now that we are going to run build-test-packages and install-build-repo
in the install and upgrade steps, we nee to disable in the upgrade
step the previous gating repo, to do se this patch add the release
to all the places need to disable it and also for debug purposes.

Change-Id: I9f5d78a719e4c127ba33e8bc99a92669fef2f108

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 21:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update Ansible playbook for Swift to add all missing devices to rings

This playbook uses the Ansible inventory to add all unused disks to the
Swift rings. Devices are only used if they are not mounted yet.

This update has some very useful improvements compared to the old
deployment method:

- Uses available disks on storage nodes automatically. No more manually
  definition of SwiftRawDisks needed
- The actual device size is used to determine the device weight, thus
  storage nodes are balanced much better if they use differently sized
  disks
- Operators can use storage nodes with different numbers of disks.
  Before this, the numbers had to be identical and disks had to be
  defined manually
- SSDs are preferred for account and container rings, resulting in a
  better performance
- Partition power is calculated based on the actual number of available
  devices

The root disk ("d1" devices) is only used if there are less disks than
replicas.

So far this playbook only adds missing devices and does not update
existing ones.

Change-Id: Ifeb33e42438e2e5297dd620b1253e0fc8096207e

commit_message:
Add Ansible playbook & Mistral workflow for Swift to update ring devices

This update has some useful improvements compared to the old
deployment method:

- Operators can use storage nodes with different numbers of disks.
  Before this, the numbers had to be identical and disks had to be
  defined manually
- Partition power is calculated based on the actual number of available
  devices

The root disk ("d1" devices) is only used if there are less disks than
replicas.

So far this playbook only adds missing devices and does not update
existing ones.

Change-Id: Ifeb33e42438e2e5297dd620b1253e0fc8096207e

commit_message:
Refactor Zuul job using base jobs to consolidate the configuration

This change introduces tripleo-ci-base and tripleo-ci-undercloud-base job
to merge common parameters into single objects.

This change also removes un-needed statements already set in parent jobs,
such as "roles: zuul", "voting: true" or the "required-projects" list of
the container-update job.

Change-Id: I9c0658e6f103911bc62e9b3b78e369e6b4be4d23

[{'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2017-08-17 12:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2017-08-17 12:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I already have tested this fix locally and works, so, Im not sure if the sym links are a posterior change and we missed to update this.
Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-08-17 12:44:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd be interested to know more about the problems you faced here - I've used this script before and it just replaces the symlink with a directory, which works fine?"}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2017-08-17 13:40:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Shardy, yeahp it actually replace the symlink with a folder, the thing is that the changes into the puppet modules are not refreshed correctly on the OC images and not visible when running the deployment.

I tried this:

* Use the script as it is: It doesn't apply the changes on your puppet modules, it runs what is on /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules and doesnt look into /etc/puppet/modules.

* Change the files on /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules: It applies the changes correctly."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-17 14:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-tripleo-common-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-common-docs-ubuntu-xenial/04701dd//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 56s
- gate-tripleo-common-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-common-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/c3ca110/ : SUCCESS in 4m 18s
- gate-tripleo-common-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-common-python27-ubuntu-xenial/f1627c0/ : SUCCESS in 9m 14s
- gate-tripleo-common-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-common-python35/5996704/ : SUCCESS in 3m 25s
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-oooq http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-oooq/e83899d/ : SUCCESS in 2h 02m 52s
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode/72c0ed1/ : SUCCESS in 1h 45m 46s
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-updates-nv http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-updates-nv/16cb5a2/ : SUCCESS in 2h 13m 36s (non-voting)
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers-nv http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers-nv/d774481/ : SUCCESS in 39m 56s (non-voting)
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode-upgrades-nv http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode-upgrades-nv/c7e5593/ : FAILURE in 1h 54m 26s (non-voting)
- tripleo-common-coverage-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check/tripleo-common-coverage-ubuntu-xenial-nv/516701e/ : SUCCESS in 5m 15s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-17 15:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded (check-tripleo pipeline).

- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq/655acc9/ : SUCCESS in 2h 42m 13s
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-containers-oooq http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-containers-oooq/a195d56/ : SUCCESS in 2h 43m 39s
- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024 http://logs.openstack.org/17/494517/1/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024/0a5ab4a/ : SUCCESS in 2h 40m 47s'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-08-18 04:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2017-08-18 08:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey @dalvarez, so, if you want to push puppet-modules in your overcloud do as follow:

# From your undercloud: 
mkdir puppet-modules
cd puppet-modules

git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo tripleo
# git clone all the modules you want to push to your OC

# Edit all the repos as needed
cd
git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-common
cd tripleo-common
git review -d 494517

cd

./tripleo-common/scripts/upload-puppet-modules --directory puppet-modules/

This will generate by default the file "/home/stack/.tripleo/environments/puppet-modules-url.yaml"

so use it your deployment command like:

openstack overcloud deploy \
...
-e /home/stack/.tripleo/environments/puppet-modules-url.yaml \
...'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2017-08-18 08:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hey @dalvarez, so, if you want to push puppet-modules in your
 > overcloud do as follow:
 > 
 > # From your undercloud:
 > mkdir puppet-modules
 > cd puppet-modules
 > 
 > git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo
 > tripleo
 > # git clone all the modules you want to push to your OC
 > 
 > # Edit all the repos as needed
 > cd
 > git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-common
 > cd tripleo-common
 > git review -d 494517
 > 
 > cd
 > 
 > ./tripleo-common/scripts/upload-puppet-modules --directory
 > puppet-modules/
 > 
 > This will generate by default the file "/home/stack/.tripleo/environments/puppet-modules-url.yaml"
 > 
 > so use it your deployment command like:
 > 
 > openstack overcloud deploy \
 > ...
 > -e /home/stack/.tripleo/environments/puppet-modules-url.yaml \
 > ...

Cool, I was just copying over the patched code to the overcloud image. This is definitely a better way :)
Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-08-18 18:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2017-08-21 13:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-08-21 13:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-08-21 13:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, I feel like overwriting the contents of an RPM is sort of bad practice... whereas extracting contents into /etc/puppet/modules functionally works right?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-09-05 11:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah I'm still not clear on this, AFAIK it works fine, but Carlos has indicated it doesn't, is this a recent regression in the puppet modulepath or something?"}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2017-09-19 08:25:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've run into a problem that is related to this issue.  The solution here is only part of the problem; because unpacking the tarball on the target host is only an *additive* process, you can still end up with cruft from the previous module lying around. This is particularly a problem if you are, for example, replacing puppet providers.  I'm going to try to work on a more complete solution to this particular issue."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-29 13:43:48.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-17 12:27:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix destination path when pushing puppet-elements

The current destination path when pushing puppet
modules is hardwired to etc/puppet/modules. This
created an issue as all the files in /etc/puppet/modules/
are symbolic links pointing to /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.

So, currently upload-puppet-modules creates a folder in
/etc/puppet/modules/ not preserving the sym link and the
changes are not applied correctly when running the deployment.

Change-Id: Ia34436b907109efe9f7a7c275364d0f6a2c58061
'}]
commit_message:
Fix destination path when pushing puppet-elements

The current destination path when pushing puppet
modules is hardwired to etc/puppet/modules. This
created an issue as all the files in /etc/puppet/modules/
are symbolic links pointing to /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules.

So, currently upload-puppet-modules creates a folder in
/etc/puppet/modules/ not preserving the sym link and the
changes are not applied correctly when running the deployment.

Change-Id: Ia34436b907109efe9f7a7c275364d0f6a2c58061

commit_message:
Handle root user case for ssh access creation

With the current approach, if we pass to the mistral workflow
overcloud_admin == root, it will create a root user instead
of amending the /root/.ssh/authorized_keys file for adding
the tripleo admin pub key.
This review set_facts for the admin-user, check and allow the
appropriate changes if the admin-user is 'root'

Change-Id: I9c6f09863ce49f4c7454eeec9945ba7d9bc89247

[{'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-08 16:07:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hmmm, chicken and egg problem with https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/14143/. I don't remember how I was able to solve it previously..."}, {'account_id': 10384, 'date': '2018-06-08 20:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

@Martin: you need to reference the upstream review in the RDO change with the Upstream-Id: keyword (see my edit there).
This will trigger the RDO job to run against this patchset downstream, but you should merge the packaging change *only* after this one got enough +2 to be merged.

And this only works for rpm-master.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-06-11 01:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Can you please to the same in the RDO .spec file?'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-06-11 01:43:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Actually, since you have other container-update.py changes to backport anyway, could you rename this file to container-check?

The .py signifies nothing useful, and its different to Ian's original script, so quickstart changes would be needed to switch to this one, instead of just working."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> @Martin: you need to reference the upstream review in the RDO
 > change with the Upstream-Id: keyword (see my edit there).
 > This will trigger the RDO job to run against this patchset
 > downstream, but you should merge the packaging change *only* after
 > this one got enough +2 to be merged.
 > 
 > And this only works for rpm-master.

Yes!!! Thanks Haïkel, now I remember.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Actually, since you have other container-update.py changes to
 > backport anyway, could you rename this file to container-check?

Done. I agree that having two names for the same script is rather... confusing. I got the name wrong in the commit msg of my other change to the file for example :)

I'm also thinking we should retire https://github.com/imain/container-check and point it to tripleo-common so folks won't bother submitting pull request there like I did."}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-11 14:06:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Rename container check script and package it

Rename container-update.py to container-check to match the original
script name at https://github.com/imain/container-check.

The goal is to start using the rpm packaged script from tripleo-common
instead of pip installing it in oooq-extra.

Change-Id: I437e532f04b521323466a2d6ff71db1d24f19d23

commit_message:
WIP, configure ARA for the overcloud deployment

In order to better understand the deployment,
task run times etc.. configure ARA for the
overcloud deployment.

To-Do:
* ensure this is only enabled in the
appropriate use cases.
* determine if any configuration is required on
the overcloud nodes themselves

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577960/
Change-Id: Iff110458cd21ec62b53825b27aff0c3cb06e8068

commit_message:
Remove obsolete section on compute ssh-key setup

Manual ssh key exchange is no longer required and is likely to clobber the ssh
config managed by tripleo.

bp tripleo-cold-migration

Change-Id: I139fd7029f593ad3ee956753f7bd9c92f2b5ffd1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-09 18:45:44.000000000', 'message': "Add upstart service support to ceph::mds

In line with ceph::mon, add support for a MDS on Ubuntu Trusty. Without this fix, Puppet outputs a error
on Ubuntu Trusty systems.

Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init.d
Error: /Stage[main]/Ceph::Mds/Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0]: Could not evaluate: Could not find init script or upstart conf file for 'ceph-mds@cephdev0'

The ceph-mds package for Trusty only contains upstart init scripts (and systemd), therefor the ceph::mds code
should use the 'ceph-mds' service name.

$ dpkg-deb -c ceph-mds_10.2.7-1trusty_amd64.deb |grep init
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       584 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all-starter.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root       619 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root        93 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all.conf

Change-Id: I22c7b57871891323d31d4f9764956d17a284ed4e
"}]
commit_message:
Add upstart service support to ceph::mds

In line with ceph::mon, add support for a MDS on Ubuntu Trusty. Without this fix, Puppet outputs a error
on Ubuntu Trusty systems.

Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.conf in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0 in /etc/init.d
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init
Debug: Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0](provider=upstart): Could not find ceph-mds@cephdev0.sh in /etc/init.d
Error: /Stage[main]/Ceph::Mds/Service[ceph-mds@cephdev0]: Could not evaluate: Could not find init script or upstart conf file for 'ceph-mds@cephdev0'

The ceph-mds package for Trusty only contains upstart init scripts (and systemd), therefor the ceph::mds code
should use the 'ceph-mds' service name.

$ dpkg-deb -c ceph-mds_10.2.7-1trusty_amd64.deb |grep init
drwxr-xr-x root/root         0 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/
-rw-r--r-- root/root       584 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all-starter.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root       619 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds.conf
-rw-r--r-- root/root        93 2017-04-10 14:18 ./etc/init/ceph-mds-all.conf

Change-Id: I22c7b57871891323d31d4f9764956d17a284ed4e

commit_message:
Include keystone::policy class into init.pp manifest.

Without inclusion of keystone::policy class it is impossible to
deploy customized keystone policies using policy.pp manifest.

Change-Id: Ib5622547a1b720dc5aa8afc140903c86ffe0339d
Closes-Bug: #1690318

commit_message:
remove glusterfs-nfs job from check queue

The job never passes, is unmaintained, and
wastes CI resources.

Change-Id: I05d7ee7f8ed01b98f2ec6cf629af1d5002b2cdbb
(cherry picked from commit fe3c1f5df34974b6000f936b1ca69dc5b459b9d8)

'}, {'created': '2018-12-28 13:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not load openstack_dashboard.settings in unit tests

The previous behavior depends on different values for
SELECTABLE_THEMES and it seems this is the reason that test_themes
imported openstack_dashboard.settings.
If we override a value in django.conf.settings, we can use
override_settings decorator. This commit uses it and
we can now avoid importing openstack_dashboard.settings in UT.

Change-Id: Id1b7b7e431b86e725ad897613ca38f423a67e52d
Closes-Bug: #1809842
'}, {'created': '2018-12-28 14:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not load openstack_dashboard.settings in unit tests

The previous behavior depends on different values for
SELECTABLE_THEMES and it seems this is the reason that test_themes
imported openstack_dashboard.settings.
If we override a value in django.conf.settings, we can use
override_settings decorator. This commit uses it and

Change-Id: Id1b7b7e431b86e725ad897613ca38f423a67e52d

commit_message:
Do not load openstack_dashboard.settings in unit tests

The previous behavior depends on different values for
SELECTABLE_THEMES and it seems this is the reason that test_themes
imported openstack_dashboard.settings.
If we override a value in django.conf.settings, we can use
override_settings decorator. This commit uses it and
we can now avoid importing openstack_dashboard.settings in UT.

Change-Id: Id1b7b7e431b86e725ad897613ca38f423a67e52d
Closes-Bug: #1809842

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 04:12:21.000000000', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Ic5264b3b79d0a4caaa7f466f8686d38f54fe1ffe
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Ic5264b3b79d0a4caaa7f466f8686d38f54fe1ffe

commit_message:
[Doc] Fix status and parameters of vol connection api

The response 'status' of initialize connection is 200, and the
"connector" parameter is required in initialize/terminate connection
API request.

This patch try to fix these wrong content.

Change-Id: I9d8c7c951b03f10fa29e3b3cc107a17e37b0e2bc

subject: Deprecate old keystone session config opts
messages: [{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-12-26 20:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2018-12-28 13:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-29 01:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-26 20:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318
(cherry picked from commit 198bea78ac01aaf8a703ca7878b2a85a1b59667e)
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318
(cherry picked from commit 198bea78ac01aaf8a703ca7878b2a85a1b59667e)

commit_message:
Fix image_name retrieval in custom-image jobs

And use a 'file://' url for the custom manila image.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330.  These
are interdependent patches but no harm is done by merging
this one first and having 623330 depend on it since retrieval
of the image name is not working correctly anyways.

Partial-Bug: #1807969

Change-Id: Ib3a74d170f159dfbc38b5302f00800f3530f4921

commit_message:
Add 'Review-Priority' for Kolla repos

Following the work done for Designate with
Id7b4c6b219899fa7ed86554257264af7efe20408, this adds a Review-Priority
label for Kolla projects to allow easier priority dashboard creation and a
cleaner way to do procedural blocking during freezes.

Change-Id: I03b71534173899b2c22987f199d1753472842a12

commit_message:
Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab
(cherry picked from commit 86ad639f4171b0c01bba030ebc3fd96ec020aa45)

How it should work after the patch is applied:

The volume type record should be marked as deleted and doesn't show up in "openstack volume type list".

commit_message:
Delete related encryption provider when a volume type is deleting

Currently volume_type_destroy() in api.py does not delete related
encryption provider (if it exists). As a result, 'encryption' table
accumulates orphaned records.
This patch fixes to delete related encryption provider when
a volume type is deleting.

Change-Id: I6472c5516dea8f81b362753b2f2a68ac5c15874a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 14:58:51.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support Docker CE for CentOS in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS.
It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used (the
default) or the newer packages at docker.com.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Partially-Implements: blueprint docker-ce

at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com.

Due to concerns about using Docker CE on Red Hat family OS, legacy
packages are used there by default. Docker CE is used by default for
Debian family OS.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
and resulted in a restart of the Docker engine and all containers.

Implements: blueprint docker-ce

Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce
"}, {'created': '2018-12-14 12:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce

newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce

commit_message:
Support Docker CE in bootstrap-servers

Kolla Ansible's bootstrap-servers command provides support for
installing the Docker engine. This is currently done using the packages
at https://apt.dockerproject.org and https://yum.dockerproject.org.
These packages are outdated, with the most recent packages from May 2017
- docker-engine-17.05.

The source for up to date docker packages is
https://download.docker.com, which was introduced with the move to
Docker Community Edition (CE) and Docker Enterprise Edition (EE).

This change adds support to bootstrap-servers for Docker CE for CentOS
and Ubuntu.

It also adds a new variable, 'enable_docker_repo', which controls
whether a package repository for Docker will be enabled.

It also adds a new variable, 'docker_legacy_packages', which controls
whether the legacy packages at dockerproject.org will be used or the
newer packages at docker.com. The default value for this variable is
'false', meaning to use Docker CE.

Upgrading from docker-engine to docker-ce has been tested on CentOS 7.5
and Ubuntu 16.04, by running 'kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers' with
'docker_legacy_packages' set to 'false'. The upgrades were successful,
but result in all containers being stopped. For this reason, the
bootstrap-servers command checks running containers prior to upgrading
packages, and ensures they are running after the package upgrade is
complete.

As mentioned in the release note, care should be taken when upgrading
Docker with clustered services, which could lose quorum. To avoid this,
use --serial or --limit to apply the change in batches.

Change-Id: I6dfd375c868870f8646ef1a8f02c70812e8f6271
Implements: blueprint docker-ce

exception in monasca-api).

commit_message:
Stack Update - NetworkDeploymentActions

Add a page regarding network configuration changes in post
deployment. Network configuration changes are disabled by
default, parameter override is required to enable network
re-configuration when necessary.

Related-Bug: #1804642
Change-Id: I0f834af0391649ac51e41fc1e9bbf3db458beac6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-18 10:04:28.000000000', 'message': 'Implement front end rate-limiting for Cinder volume

Cinder adds Quality-of-Service control interface to allow admin to
specify QoS parameters as well as the place where these parameters
should be consumed (Front-end: Nova Compute, Back-end: Cinder
Volume, or Both) for volume types.  KVM and other hypervisor is
known to be able to do disk rate-limit control (one form of QoS)
for virtual disks, this patch enables Nova Compute to extract
rate-limit parameters for volumes while attaching, currently
libvirt only.

implement bp volume-rate-limiting

Change-Id: Ibcc8f15ab744600e6f814b46935f8022d78074fc
'}]
commit_message:
Implement front end rate-limiting for Cinder volume

Cinder adds Quality-of-Service control interface to allow admin to
specify QoS parameters as well as the place where these parameters
should be consumed (Front-end: Nova Compute, Back-end: Cinder
Volume, or Both) for volume types.  KVM and other hypervisor is
known to be able to do disk rate-limit control (one form of QoS)
for virtual disks, this patch enables Nova Compute to extract
rate-limit parameters for volumes while attaching, currently
libvirt only.

implement bp volume-rate-limiting

Change-Id: Ibcc8f15ab744600e6f814b46935f8022d78074fc

It failed at python3-tempestconf itself:- No package python3-tempestconf available: http://logs.openstack.org/56/618056/6/check/tripleo-ci-fedora-28-standalone/678f2ba/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-19_18_51_42_634131


before testing in ci just for package availability it's good to check in repo, i would suggest to identify all package install before enabling some role like validate-tempest here, and fix packaging in parallel, this would help in saving some CI resources, and possibly speed up the Fedora support.

you can check package availability by directly looking into the repo url or using below command:-

repoquery --repofrompath=tmp,https://trunk-fedora.rdoproject.org/fedora/current --repofrompath=tmp2,https://trunk-fedora.rdoproject.org/fedora/stable-base/latest --disablerepo=* --enablerepo=tmp,tmp2  python3-junitxml openstack-tempest python3-tempestconf

From above u can check python3-tempestconf is not available yet.

commit_message:
Remove standalone quickstart.sh gating_repo var

The compreosed_gating_repo is set by the build-test-packages role to
denote that a gating_repo is generated in case of change at tq or tqe
this gating repo is not generated and the fact is not set, if we force
the fact it will  be a false positive for gating repo.

Change-Id: Id20a048bf895aabf13656c7ce4d5ba1873e74cb7

commit_message:
[cinder,glance] don't randomize job names

Random job names mean `helm upgrade` or indeed anything looks for
changes from rendered templates will see changes when there are none
causing churn and restarts.

Change-Id: I44331e00c288b517fccf69a4b60435efa2e13d61

In the CI, the deployed server nodes are prepared by setting vxlan on the br-ex on all nodes with the control plane IP. Since the ifcfg files are not created, on reboot the IP of the node (on br-ex) is lost and the ansible times out waiting for the node to be started. Here is the related code [2] for vxlan networking on setup, I am not sure if we need to enhance this, your inputs?

This patch only adds the service and it does not enable the reboot for any of the node. "KernelArgs" need to associated with "ComputeParameters" to use the reboot (part of the new environment file). I need to work with CI team to identify which feature set to use for adding the reboot testing.

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/41/566241/15/openstack-check/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-master/c0cf5c2/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz#_2018-07-19_07_01_01
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/undercloud-setup/templates/vxlan_networking.sh.j2#L147'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-07-30 08:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17: Patch Set 16 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-07-30 08:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-12-28 03:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add BootParams service to ovb-ha

BootParams service allows to set the kernel args, reboot and wait
for the node reboot to complete, only when the KenelArgs is
applied on a role parameter. Enabling the service for ovb-ha
and added a env file for setting KernelArgs so that it can be
applied on oooq featureset config.

Change-Id: I777f3193bcf8feb12b6935808470ed94a3fefd6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 23:59:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix global lock path usage

The option `systemd_lock_path` is intended to be set globally
and locally however the global implementation has never been
implemented.

  * The global option will ensure the run and lock path is setup
    for all services within the `systemd_services` array.
  * The local option provices a way to override a global lock path
    based on specific service needs.

Change-Id: I373b8905c01ff666b5705bd3bb3c76c3e74a64ab

commit_message:
Ironic Inspector - disjoint ip range(s) for HA

Allow tht parameter IronicInspectorSubnets to specify
per-instance ip range(s) using hostname as key for each
list of ip ranges. For HA deployments use disjoint
address pools to avoid potential address conflict.

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-overcloud
Change-Id: Ifae513265b8c35d98012f14f951bac33ae90b66c
(cherry picked from commit c2d84b4fee03e022a51c34853801ed10d27c0025)

commit_message:
Allow user to define a custom tuned profile

Add custom_profile parameter to tripleo::profile::base::tuned
which may a string in INI format describing a tuned profile
which puppet will then create and apply with the name supplied
by the profile parameter.

Change-Id: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Related-Bug: #1800232
(cherry picked from commit 3c953e877b74f2c4d93e57d3b093d9171e897e72)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-22 02:55:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct case for WEBSSO_ENABLED config setting

Horizon is picky about the case of the value used for the
WEBSSO_ENABLED setting in local_settings.  When enabled, it expects
the value to be "True".  Currently, we set it to "true", which
causes Horizon to throw a 500 error when accessing the login page.
This patch sets the value using the proper case.

Change-Id: Ic71a6c4b50556a1820a5f86bfc5a3e5102955c7b
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct case for WEBSSO_ENABLED config setting

Horizon is picky about the case of the value used for the
WEBSSO_ENABLED setting in local_settings.  When enabled, it expects
the value to be "True".  Currently, we set it to "true", which
causes Horizon to throw a 500 error when accessing the login page.
This patch sets the value using the proper case.

Change-Id: Ic71a6c4b50556a1820a5f86bfc5a3e5102955c7b

Add support to remove horizon dashboards

The initial implemention assumed you wanted
to install dashboard. This adds support to
remove/uninstall dashboard with the resource.

Change-Id: Ie008d805a05d8152721220ffdf7c29f3afc65baa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 04:07:46.000000000', 'message': "Correct openid federation protocol name in httpd template

Keystone requires the auth method for federation using OpenID
Connect to be 'openid', which we already enforce in puppet-keystone.
The protocol name that shows up in the federation URLs in the httpd
config must match the auth method.  We have a few locations that
don't match, which results in an invalid configuration.

This patch corrects the protocol in the locations protected by
mod_auth_openidc and the OIDCRedirectURI directives.

Change-Id: I02027676c532b447e56c8774c25015ec9a40b414
"}]
commit_message:
Correct openid federation protocol name in httpd template

Keystone requires the auth method for federation using OpenID
Connect to be 'openid', which we already enforce in puppet-keystone.
The protocol name that shows up in the federation URLs in the httpd
config must match the auth method.  We have a few locations that
don't match, which results in an invalid configuration.

This patch corrects the protocol in the locations protected by
mod_auth_openidc and the OIDCRedirectURI directives.

Change-Id: I02027676c532b447e56c8774c25015ec9a40b414

commit_message:
Use s3token proveded by swift3 instead of keystonemiddleware

As of swift3 1.11, the swift3 team took over maintenance of the
s3token middleware [1]. Following a breaking API change [2], the old
keystonemiddleware-provided version won't work anymore.

This change does not warrant a patch on master (or even stable/rocky),
as the middleware has changed homes again, this time to swift [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/swift3/commit/b626a3c
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift3/commit/cd094ee
[3] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/bb93e6a

Change-Id: I6125f52dcba4751e2a6726101f115fded3a2b921

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 20:16:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up force live migration completion docs

This change does a few things:

* Links live_migration_completion_timeout to the config
  option guide.

* Links the force complete API reference to the feature support
  matrix to see which drivers support the operation.

* Fixes the server status mentioned in the troubleshooting for
  the force complete API reference (a live migrating server
  status is MIGRATING, not ACTIVE). The same text is copied to the
  abort live migration API reference troubleshooting for
  consistency (and since using the server status is more natural than
  the task_state).

* Links to the admin guide for troubleshooting live migration
  timeouts.

Change-Id: I496d3f4b99e3d7e978c7ecb13ab3b67023fcb919
Closes-Bug: #1808579
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up force live migration completion docs

This change does a few things:

* Links live_migration_completion_timeout to the config
  option guide.

* Links the force complete API reference to the feature support
  matrix to see which drivers support the operation.

* Fixes the server status mentioned in the troubleshooting for
  the force complete API reference (a live migrating server
  status is MIGRATING, not ACTIVE). The same text is copied to the
  abort live migration API reference troubleshooting for
  consistency (and since using the server status is more natural than
  the task_state).

* Links to the admin guide for troubleshooting live migration
  timeouts.

Change-Id: I496d3f4b99e3d7e978c7ecb13ab3b67023fcb919
Closes-Bug: #1808579

commit_message:
use neutron-lib for resource_extend

The neutron code is already shimmed to use neutron-lib for the
neutron.db._resource_extend module [1].

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib for resource_extend
rather than neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624179/

Change-Id: Ib1035a0711d45b685c7d20fb1d27132562ddedf6

to configure SP with samltest.id.

commit_message:
py3: Port the acl, account_quotas, cname_lookup, container_sync

These are trivial, but need to be done sooner or later.

About the isEnabledFor, our FakeLogger causes this on py3:
  AttributeError: 'FakeLogger' object has no attribute '_cache'
Adding the isEnabledFor short-cuts a need for that private member.

Change-Id: I4d1df857a24801fe2a396dc003719f54d099f72c

commit_message:
[Configuration] Remove mitaka file.

Remove the mitaka configuration file to fix 404 links. The mitaka
release is no longer supported by the community.

Change-Id: I5c7995afe49fd1f7d66b8df6790c8f5917220b7d
Closes-Bug: #1722602

commit_message:
Pass elevated admin context when fetching snat router for FIP to unbound port

If a floating IP is assigned to an unbound port, it is scheduled to the SNAT router.
This fails when the router is in a different tenant and user is not an admin.
This was previously working, but broken with the changes for enabling
centralized FIP/unbound port.

A common usecase for this when not using a true VIP is a port and Floating IP may be
precreated as a pair, and then attached to a VM.
It works otherwise if the port is already bound to a VM.

Change-Id: I0ee5344216fdff0a9e3bd6fa165f8d0aa736ac85
Closes-Bug: #1802006

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-26 01:50:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rfc3986.is_valid_uri deprecation warnings

The rfc3986.is_valid_uri has been deprecated in 1.1.0.
It generates the following warnings.

DeprecationWarning: Please use rfc3986.validators.Validator instead.
This method will be eventually removed.

So this patch replaces rfc3986.is_valid_uri with
rfc3986.validators.Validator.

Even after applying this patch, the warnings are still output
because it is caused by oslo.config.
The fix for oslo.config will be done in another patch.

Change-Id: I70aebad6c6bd384dbd11ef732226356922bf1913
Closes-Bug: #1809755
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rfc3986.is_valid_uri deprecation warnings

The rfc3986.is_valid_uri has been deprecated in 1.1.0.
It generates the following warnings.

DeprecationWarning: Please use rfc3986.validators.Validator instead.
This method will be eventually removed.

So this patch replaces rfc3986.is_valid_uri with
rfc3986.validators.Validator.

Even after applying this patch, the warnings are still output
because it is caused by oslo.config.
The fix for oslo.config will be done in another patch.

Change-Id: I70aebad6c6bd384dbd11ef732226356922bf1913
Closes-Bug: #1809755

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 18:07:21.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Update Armada gate to Ocata, update LMA configs

This updates the Armada gate to deploy Ocata instead of Newton,
which allows the use of the oslo log fluentd handler and formatter
for OpenStack service logs. This also updates fluentd's configs to
appropriately tag all logged events with their respective log
levels, includes a new template to be created in Elasticsearch via
the fluent-logging template job that reflects the fields added to
the openstack service logs, and creates a separate index output to
Elasticsearch to house openstack service logs.

This also updates the fluentd configuration to drop duplicate
OpenStack logged events captured via fluentbit. This helps reduce
the amount of storage Elasticsearch consumes to store and index
these logged events.

The aim is to use the Armada gate to provide a production-like
deployment instead of using it to recreate the multinode gates.
This will be expanded to include additional fluentd/fluentbit
optimizations through filters, as well as providing a base to
explore using the LMA stack to export information from the gate
as part of post-run jobs in the future

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00
"}, {'created': '2018-08-14 18:09:28.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Update Armada gate to Ocata, update LMA configs

This updates the Armada gate to deploy Ocata instead of Newton,
which allows the use of the oslo log fluentd handler and formatter
for OpenStack service logs. This also updates fluentd's configs to
appropriately tag all logged events with their respective log
levels, includes a new template to be created in Elasticsearch via
the fluent-logging template job that reflects the fields added to
the openstack service logs, and creates a separate index output to
Elasticsearch to house openstack service logs. This also removes
barbican from the deployment manifest to help conserve resourcesy

The aim is to use the Armada gate to provide a production-like
deployment instead of using it to recreate the multinode gates.
This will be expanded to include additional fluentd/fluentbit
optimizations through filters, as well as providing a base to
explore using the LMA stack to export information from the gate
as part of post-run jobs in the future

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00
"}, {'created': '2018-08-14 18:29:53.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Update Armada gate to Ocata, update LMA configs

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00
"}, {'created': '2018-08-14 20:28:22.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Add Ocata Armada gate

This patchset adds an Armada gate for the Ocata release, and
creates separate Newton and Ocata manifests for osh and the
osh-infra components. This includes updating the LMA
configurations to leverage the fluent handler/formatter that was
introduced in oslo.logging for the Ocata release. Fluentd's
configuration is modified to provide a mechanism for filtering out
duplicate logs, tagging logged events with their log level, and
creating separate indexes for the different log types created by
the elasticsearch templates

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00
"}, {'created': '2018-08-15 14:05:01.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Add Ocata Armada gate

osh-infra components. This includes updating the LMA
configurations to leverage the fluent handler/formatter that was
introduced in oslo.logging for the Ocata release. Fluentd's
configuration is modified to provide a mechanism for filtering out
duplicate logs, tagging logged events with their log level, and
creating separate indexes for the different log types created by
the elasticsearch templates

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00

"}, {'created': '2018-10-17 13:18:17.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Manifest updates for Ocata release

This patchset updates the chart configuration overrides to account
for functionality supported with the move to Ocata over Newton.
This includes updating the OpenStack service logging configuration
to leverage the fluent handler/formatter that was introduced in the
Ocata release, updating Fluentd's configuration to filter out
duplicate logs, tagging logged events with their log level, and
creating separate indexes for the different log types created by
the elasticsearch templates. This also adds support for leveraging
ceph-radosgw's s3 API for Elasticsearch snapshots.

This also removes the barbican chart deployment from the
armada gate, to help alleviate resource consumption.

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00
"}, {'created': '2018-10-17 13:19:35.000000000', 'message': "Armada: Manifest updates for Ocata release

commit_message:
Armada: Manifest updates for Ocata release

This patchset updates the chart configuration overrides to account
for functionality supported with the move to Ocata over Newton.
This includes updating the OpenStack service logging configuration
to leverage the fluent handler/formatter that was introduced in the
Ocata release, updating Fluentd's configuration to filter out
duplicate logs, tagging logged events with their log level, and
creating separate indexes for the different log types created by
the elasticsearch templates. This also adds support for leveraging
ceph-radosgw's s3 API for Elasticsearch snapshots.

This also removes the barbican chart deployment from the
armada gate, to help alleviate resource consumption.

Change-Id: I45128bf102909e1762b832fc16ad04bedcfe4f00

commit_message:
Neutron: add log config file to ovs agent chart.

neutron-sanity-check module load logging.conf file
but there is no config file.

Change-Id: I5e6dd298ccd9fb5432002f76bad3931ec035bb16
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove noop zuul job from tripleo templates

noop job should never be included in templates as it would create
additional noop jobs alongside normal jobs. Its sole purpose is to
be used by zuul for repositories that do not yet have their own job
defined.

If you spot noop job alongside other jobs is a clear sign of zuul job
or job-template misconfiguration.

Change-Id: I98b2211fc9cb6569c53b73ab203df1f911c874f7

commit_message:
Convert policy.json into policy-in-code

This commit converts the existing neutron-dynamic-routing policy.json
into policy-in-code.

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-policy-in-code

Change-Id: I4f99739ca8b979ddf69c52c3f1b36e320326db8d

commit_message:
Added support for installing tempest plugins from git

In order to use it, in any FS, set tempest_format to venv
and then set:
tempest_plugins_venv:
  - '<complete upstream openstack tempest plugin git url>'

Change-Id: I95a4449ca3976a914faf1ba5f3f4c0e756a6fefc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-24 15:29:17.000000000', 'message': "DNM: functional: Do not inherit from SqlTestCaseLight

Looks like inheriting from SqlTestCaseLight in one tests
and from SqlTestCase at the same time may cause errors
in functional tests. According to comments in SqlTestCaseLight
implementation in Neutron, that's intended for unit tests
only. This patch is changing it to confirm that we no
longer hit the issues described in the referred bug below.

Change-Id: Id9c917f604024f6c82b1ff638ba58bce1f2b306b
Partial-Bug: #1808146
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-12-26 18:55:53.000000000', 'message': "functional: Do not inherit from SqlTestCaseLight

Inheriting from SqlTestCaseLight in some tests and from
SqlTestCase in some others at the same time may cause errors
in functional tests. According to comments in SqlTestCaseLight
implementation in Neutron, that's intended for unit tests
only. This patch is changing it so that all tests inherit
from the same Sql Base class.

For a long time, we've been hitting failures in gate due to
race conditions in functional tests caused by this issue.

Change-Id: Id9c917f604024f6c82b1ff638ba58bce1f2b306b
Closes-Bug: #1808146
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
functional: Do not inherit from SqlTestCaseLight

Inheriting from SqlTestCaseLight in some tests and from
SqlTestCase in some others at the same time may cause errors
in functional tests. According to comments in SqlTestCaseLight
implementation in Neutron, that's intended for unit tests
only. This patch is changing it so that all tests inherit
from the same Sql Base class.

For a long time, we've been hitting failures in gate due to
race conditions in functional tests caused by this issue.

Change-Id: Id9c917f604024f6c82b1ff638ba58bce1f2b306b
Closes-Bug: #1808146
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable runAsUser in pod level

This patchset enables and moves the securityContext: runAsUser to the pod
level, and uses a non-root user (UID != 0) wherever applicable.

Depends-On: I95264c933b51e2a8e38f63faa1e239bb3c1ebfda
Change-Id: I81f6e11fe31ab7333a3805399b2e5326ec1e06a7
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Install correct python version packages at tempest

The role validate-tempest was installing python- for f28 we need to
install python3 packages.

used/needed by https://review.openstack.org/618056

messages:

This looks ok for now, though highlights the need to revisit the strategy used for ranger checks. It would be nice to bring these inline with other services, and reduce the dependency on external services.'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-12-27 14:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

That's a big readiness value - I think this PS can go in as a duct-tape fix, but we need to look for ways to streamline the process and get startup faster.

Low-hanging fruit idea: was chatting w/ Mark B, and he thought perhaps a shallow clone would be faster.

More effort idea, but maybe worth it:  perhaps an in-cluster git repo would reduce startup time while also removing an external dependency.  In Airship we're doing something similar for deb packages, and calling it a "mini mirror".'}, {'account_id': 18538, 'date': '2018-12-27 15:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Fix glance network policy to allow cinder

cinder volume can be created with glance image.
but network policy of glance didn't allow for cinder.
so it should be added cinder podSelector on glance network policy.

ex. openstack volume create --image XXX --size 1 valume-name

Change-Id: Ia41961e16e2583ab571ed8a851a2ee2d14aa71c5
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Horizon: add tcp port to network policy for nodeport

This patch fixes the network policy issue when use nodeport mode.
If you enable node port witout this patch, it will block by network policy.
so should be allowed tcp port of horizon when use nodeport.

Change-Id: I5e2622c29c6a32ab6d1c5d99d84d4f13382dab65
Signed-off-by: Hyunkook Cho <hk0713.cho@samsung.com>

subject: Add setting of target dev for vif vhostuser
messages: [{'account_id': 27794, 'date': '2018-12-27 14:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27794, 'date': '2018-12-27 15:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nrebranch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 14:58:36.000000000', 'message': "Add setting of target dev for vif vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets one if tag was
found.

The fix will cause get_interface_by_cfg() to
return proper interface as target_dev will be
set to vif_name in _set_config_VIFVHostUser()

Change-Id: I8f830f3a2baae981e1993dcc571d009bea8c38da
Closes-Bug: #1807340
"}]
commit_message:
Add setting of target dev for vif vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets one if tag was
found.

The fix will cause get_interface_by_cfg() to
return proper interface as target_dev will be
set to vif_name in _set_config_VIFVHostUser()

Change-Id: I8f830f3a2baae981e1993dcc571d009bea8c38da
Closes-Bug: #1807340

commit_message:
Add local filesystem certficiate options to common config

Currently, config options in certificates/common/local.py does not emit when
oslo-config-generator used since list_opts() only care about the certificates
variable in common config.

It confuses operators who want to check the options using generation step.
Add the options to common certificates in order to auto-generate.

Change-Id: I717aeaec098f865fa47093c53d9aaafd4ea08853
Story: 2004680
Tasks: 28672

commit_message:
Makes reproducer output more human friendly (readable)

Use Ansible debug output callback unless user overrides it with his
own value. Same output is prefered on CI.

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
