subject: Add tornado to global requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-11-09 13:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-10 08:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-11 13:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-11 15:42:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

iirc we did not want to use this package in openstack (instead, use other libs).  for now I'm -1 until I can talk to tony and/or doug."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-23 05:50:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Part of the mission of the requirements team is to ensure that we don't add needless functional duplication in global-requirements to make all OpenStack projects feel similar.   We already have Falcon and Flask in g-r why do we need another framework here?

While it may not be the first choice of the monasca team why can't they use one of those?  What is the 'killer feature' that Tornado has that can't be done in the others?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-12-05 20:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 14162, 'date': '2018-12-27 11:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 13:34:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add tornado to global requirements

The monasca-analytics package tornado uses as a web service.
Add tornado to global list because requirements gate jobs to fail.
tornado was already listed in upper-constraints.txt.

Is the library actively maintained?
    Yes, last release about 2 months ago

Is the library good code?
    Yes

Is the library python 3 compatible?
    Yes

Is the library license compatible?
    Yes - Apache License 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?
    Yes, There is a pypi package available.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?
    No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?
    Yes, for monasca-analytics

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
    Yes

Do I need to update anything else?
    No

Change-Id: I21bed8f990caf4dc9fbee7b1ab602f6552ba83bd

commit_message:
Add tornado to global requirements

The monasca-analytics package tornado uses as a web service.
Add tornado to global list because requirements gate jobs to fail.
tornado was already listed in upper-constraints.txt.

Is the library actively maintained?
    Yes, last release about 2 months ago

Is the library good code?
    Yes

Is the library python 3 compatible?
    Yes

Is the library license compatible?
    Yes - Apache License 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?
    Yes, There is a pypi package available.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?
    No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?
    Yes, for monasca-analytics

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
    Yes

Do I need to update anything else?
    No

Change-Id: I21bed8f990caf4dc9fbee7b1ab602f6552ba83bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 04:31:11.000000000', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Icc1535c2d5f53cea746380f5e0ab7035076acbd9
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: Icc1535c2d5f53cea746380f5e0ab7035076acbd9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 22:52:47.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - provider/openstack: force US-ASCII parse_csv

Untested and WIP, we probably need more code, to rescue in case of
encoding failure.

Puppet often has troubles to deal with non ASCII content, even in the
new versions.
This bugfix would allow to have UTF8 caracters in CSV content, used by
Puppet. It needs advanced tested to avoid a situation where a resource
would not be idempotent anymore because it would be re-created again
without accents or something.

Change-Id: I222a2bdf833be81aaf8a782dff85eed48478603d
Related-Bug: #1744075
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP - provider/openstack: force US-ASCII parse_csv

Untested and WIP, we probably need more code, to rescue in case of
encoding failure.

Puppet often has troubles to deal with non ASCII content, even in the
new versions.
This bugfix would allow to have UTF8 caracters in CSV content, used by
Puppet. It needs advanced tested to avoid a situation where a resource
would not be idempotent anymore because it would be re-created again
without accents or something.

Change-Id: I222a2bdf833be81aaf8a782dff85eed48478603d
Related-Bug: #1744075
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Driver reinitialization after failure

This is an update to the spec of driver reinitialization after the discussion
that we had on the Cinder meeting.

Change-Id: Ic8b58efb240efa535cc5cb039139b497b48f1570
Implements: blueprint driver-initialization-after-fail

Currently, you cannot deploy custom policy files in horizon for disabled
openstack projects.

This patch allows customizing disabled openstack projects policy files used by
horizon.
It does so by creating variables of the form `enable_*_policy` and
setting these to the relevant `enable_*` variables by default. This
ensures backwards compatibility.

This patch is useful when you are migrating to kolla-ansible from
another deployment method one openstack project at a time and you have
custom policy files deployed by the old method.

commit_message:
Allow custom horizon policy files for disabled openstack projects.

Currently, you cannot deploy custom policy files in horizon for disabled
openstack projects that don't have a horizon plugin.

This patch allows customizing disabled openstack projects policy files
used by horizon.  For services that do not have horizon plugins, it
creates variables of the form `enable_*_horizon_policy_file` and sets
these to the relevant `enable_*` variables by default. This ensures
backwards compatibility.

This patch is useful when you are migrating to kolla-ansible from
another deployment method one openstack project at a time and you have
custom policy files deployed by the old method.

Partially-Implements: blueprint docs-migrating-to-kolla
Closes-Bug: #1809314
Change-Id: Ifc33ef65759fa4831c24d177b272af5b45f80931

Delete unused code

This patch removes some unused code and empty setUp/tearDown/etc
methods.

It's not required at this point but since I'm refactoring the code let's
make our codebase a bit smaller.

commit_message:
remove glusterfs-nfs job from check queue

The job never passes, is unmaintained, and
wastes CI resources.

Change-Id: I05d7ee7f8ed01b98f2ec6cf629af1d5002b2cdbb
(cherry picked from commit fe3c1f5df34974b6000f936b1ca69dc5b459b9d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-24 09:48:06.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491

commit_message:
Update docs for building ovs-dpdk images

Correcting and clarifying the documention for how to build OVS images
with DPDK support:

 * The additional heading was confusing and the following sentence even
   more so.
 * Fixed the image name in the build command.
 * Updated the OVS and DPDK version numbers to current stable versions.

Change-Id: Ib12be3da4f1fc14f1fed990a8abcdf87477a4e1b

commit_message:
diskimage-create: Support testing other image types

When building image types other then qcow2 there's no way to test them
currently. When specifying an existing file, just use that for testing.

Change-Id: I99f1a9e10642c4611c9b8985a6945bd82f1cce50
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

Since 'enable_cpu_pinning' is a non-nullable field so we need
to initialize this field on creating the compute node object.

subject: Should we remove 'provider' in resource provider allocation
messages:
[{'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-04 02:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-04-04 03:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I did have the same thought about why didn't we just use `resource allocation` instead of `resource provider allocation`. IMHO, I vote for removing `provider`.  Here is what I think:

1. We use `resource provider inventory list` to get inventory of a *resource provider*. UUID of RP is the positional argument here. It's the same as other operations like `resource provider inventory delete/show/class set` etc.
2. But we use `resource provider allocation show/set/delete` to show/set/delete allocations for a consumer, aka, an instance. UUID of a consumer is the positional argument here.

See? Doesn't that `resource allocation xxx` make more sense?

:-)"}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-04-04 03:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI, there should be a releasenote to describe the changes. And the docs should be updated too.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:09:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There are some old 'resource provider allocation' command executions in osc_placement/tests/functional/base.py.
They should be fixed."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Probably your option is more semantically correct, but it was merged and released and with that change backward compatibility is broken with queens release. I would rather stay it as is.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-12-27 01:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 02:58:02.000000000', 'message': "Should we remove 'provider' in resource provider allocation

Now we have four commands about allocation

* resource provider allocation delete
* resource provider allocation set
* resource provider allocation show

and map to API:

    '/allocations/{consumer_uuid}': {
        'GET': allocation.list_for_consumer,
        'PUT': allocation.set_allocations_for_consumer,
        'DELETE': allocation.delete_allocations,
    },

But I just think why these are NOT defined as:
* resource allocation delete
* resource allocation set
* resource allocation show

Because we have a list for provider:
    '/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations': {
        'GET': allocation.list_for_resource_provider,
    },

If we want to add support for this API, maybe using
``resource provider allocation show`` is more suitable in here.

So, I just wanna sure is there some special consideration on here.

Change-Id: I106ebf07dc9d45f3b1867345e87b7cc1ce323b59
"}]
commit_message:
Should we remove 'provider' in resource provider allocation

Now we have four commands about allocation

* resource provider allocation delete
* resource provider allocation set
* resource provider allocation show

and map to API:

    '/allocations/{consumer_uuid}': {
        'GET': allocation.list_for_consumer,
        'PUT': allocation.set_allocations_for_consumer,
        'DELETE': allocation.delete_allocations,
    },

But I just think why these are NOT defined as:
* resource allocation delete
* resource allocation set
* resource allocation show

Because we have a list for provider:
    '/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations': {
        'GET': allocation.list_for_resource_provider,
    },

If we want to add support for this API, maybe using
``resource provider allocation show`` is more suitable in here.

So, I just wanna sure is there some special consideration on here.

Change-Id: I106ebf07dc9d45f3b1867345e87b7cc1ce323b59

commit_message:
Catch rbd NoSpace exception

Unhelpful error (HTTP 500, Internal Server Error) received if image
creation failed due to insufficient free space. This patch catches rbd
NoSpace exception and re-raise the exact exception
glance_store.StorageFull, and the http client will receive "HTTP 413
Request Entity Too Large".

Closes-Bug: #1808456
Change-Id: Id787d3ae6f761aaa31d2fc7dd26d2f7d327367d4
Co-authored-by: Stefan Dinescu <stefan.dinescu@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Refactor port creation code

Introduce a method 'create_port' in base test class.
This allows subclass reuse the port creation logic.

Change-Id: Ib5ed02b765f22f9231d1d380152ab80478412351

api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder

generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'

that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

commit_message:
Deprecate old keystone session config opts

In the past, the options ca_certificates_file,
nova_ca_certificates_file, cinder_ca_certificates_file,
api_insecure, nova_api_insecure, cinder_api_insecure
were supplied to instantiate nova, neutron and cinder
clients. These options have now been subsumed in a more
generic way into the Keystone session logic as 'cafile'
and 'insecure'. Deprecate the older options in Stein so
that we can remove them in a future release.

This deprecation began many releases ago when we switched
to using keystone sessions [1]. However, we were still
overriding the values of "insecure" and "cafile" if provided,
forcing users to continue using deprecated parameters
"api_insecure" and "ca_certificates_file". So despite
this fix originating in the Stein release, it would be
prudent to backport it to all maintained releases and
remove support for these older options in/beyond Train
release (9.0.0).

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Change-Id: I148e9079c7c1ab119f519f727d4ad97758473325
Related-Bug: #1802393
Closes-Bug: #1809318

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 19:22:48.000000000', 'message': 'dhcp: serializing port delete and network rpc calls

The port delete events are not synchronized with network rpc events.  This
creates a condition which makes it possible for a port delete event to be
processed just before a previously started network query completes.

The problematic order of operations is as follows:

  1) a network is scheduled to an agent; a network rpc is sent to the
     agent

  2) the agent queries the network data from the server

  3) while that query is in progress a port on that network is deleted; a
     port rpc is sent to the agent

  4) that port delete rpc is received before the network query rpc
     completes

  5) the port delete results in no action because the port was not present
     on the agent

  6) the network query finishes and adds the port to the cache (even
     though the port has already been deleted)

  7) some time passes and a new port is configured with the same IP
     address as the port that was deleted in (3)

  8) the dhcp host file is corrupted with 2 entries for the same IP
     address.

  9) dhcp queries for the newest port is rejected because of the duplicate
     entry in the dhcp host file.

The solution is to add the network_id to the port_delete_end rpc event
so that the _net_lock(network_id) synchronization point can be acquired
so that it is processed serially with other network related events.

To ensure backwards compatibility with newer agents running against older
servers the determination of which network_id value to use in the lock is
handled using a utility that will fallback to the previous mode of operation
whenever the network_id attribute is not present in the *_delete_end RPC
events.  That utility can be removed in the future when it is guaranteed
that the network_id attribute will be present in RPC messages from the
server.

Closes-Bug: #1732456

Change-Id: I735f8b1c9248b12e5feb6cbe970cf67f321e6ebc
(cherry picked from commit fa78b580105111b1238e5b18d415b08e8fb35d97)

commit_message:
dhcp: serializing port delete and network rpc calls

The port delete events are not synchronized with network rpc events.  This
creates a condition which makes it possible for a port delete event to be
processed just before a previously started network query completes.

The problematic order of operations is as follows:

  1) a network is scheduled to an agent; a network rpc is sent to the
     agent

  2) the agent queries the network data from the server

  3) while that query is in progress a port on that network is deleted; a
     port rpc is sent to the agent

  4) that port delete rpc is received before the network query rpc
     completes

  5) the port delete results in no action because the port was not present
     on the agent

  6) the network query finishes and adds the port to the cache (even
     though the port has already been deleted)

  7) some time passes and a new port is configured with the same IP
     address as the port that was deleted in (3)

  8) the dhcp host file is corrupted with 2 entries for the same IP
     address.

  9) dhcp queries for the newest port is rejected because of the duplicate
     entry in the dhcp host file.

The solution is to add the network_id to the port_delete_end rpc event
so that the _net_lock(network_id) synchronization point can be acquired
so that it is processed serially with other network related events.

To ensure backwards compatibility with newer agents running against older
servers the determination of which network_id value to use in the lock is
handled using a utility that will fallback to the previous mode of operation
whenever the network_id attribute is not present in the *_delete_end RPC
events.  That utility can be removed in the future when it is guaranteed
that the network_id attribute will be present in RPC messages from the
server.

Closes-Bug: #1732456

Change-Id: I735f8b1c9248b12e5feb6cbe970cf67f321e6ebc
(cherry picked from commit fa78b580105111b1238e5b18d415b08e8fb35d97)

commit_message:
Instances column is shortened so it fits properly

The 'Time since created' column name has been shortened to 'Age'
in project instances and admin instances meaning it fits properly
in table header cell and doesn't cause table header height to
increase.

Closes-Bug: #1614287

Change-Id: I94fc9eb260050e187445abd8236ac414b885b467
Co-Authored-By: Sam Wright <swright.wellington@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update table header checkbox after searching

Now, the table header checkbox has no releationship with
the searching on page by javasricpt. This will cause two
situations:
- The table header checkbox is checked and delete button
  is enable when there is nothing under table.
- The table header checkbox is not checked when all rows
  filtered out are checked.

This commit will update the table header checkbox after
searching on page side, and fix the above bug suitable.

Change-Id: Ic290a67c7c85644bdedc80930c7d5be772fabde0
Closes-Bug: #1806342

commit_message:
Check if the alert box has a sibling element, delete its parent if it doesn't exist

Steps：
1.Click the Create Network button
2.Enter 123 in the Allocation Pools
3.Then click on the Create button
4.When the page returns to the Create Network page,
click the Back button and then click the Next button,
you will find that the page content disappears.

Change-Id: I6210f6a1ada2826f83aa59318fb48f38da03cb89
Closes-Bug: #1804374

commit_message:
Show password expiration date on user detail

Since keystone v3.7 the user responds object returns
the password_expires_at attribute. We can show this on
the detail page of the user.

Change-Id: I28b34644066c5d14201b2592d2e07484dfb31c42
Closes-Bug: #1798380

commit_message:
Displays role assignment through group in user details

In the tab role assignments of the user details view, the role
assignments the user has got through groups are added.

In the column "role" of the table, the text "(through group GROUP_NAME)"
is specified next to the role name.

Change-Id: I6bbf3ef61a7c4e99e0b1ddce90ae1c12a3e18369
Closes-Bug: #1792524

commit_message:
Add group tab in user details view.

Add an extra tab "groups" in the user details view which
displays the groups of the user.

The groups are displayed in a table which is an extansion
(inheritance) of the group table used in the Group panel.

Change-Id: I0ffaafaeacba0a0863c2550ac1e3649c9dd85983
Partial-Bug: #1792524

commit_message:
Add role assignment tab in the user details view.

Add an extra tab "role assignments" in the user details view
which displays all the project/role domain/role of the current
user.

The role assignments are displayed in a table.
The project/domain column is clickable and forward to the project
/domain detail view.

Change-Id: Iefe17856e60b84d089f722c3a30e9ede21d8ce47
Partial-Bug: #1792524
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

remove cinder v1 endpoint

now,cinder does not support v1 endpoint,so no need to create it in
keystone

Change-Id: I4b3bbf24c19a996e73f4b360beeb20a110907a6d

commit_message:
Make open file as rb mode for murano rally test

Murano rally test will failed when open file as r mode in python3,
change open as rb mode to pass the test in python3.

Change-Id: I84221bc1991e48cbdd0f07e967719a36b2b8c98e

subject: Fix python3 Compatibility for urllib2
messages:
[{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-12-26 12:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2018-12-26 12:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

why six.moves.urllib is not applicable?'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-12-26 12:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> why six.moves.urllib is not applicable?

yes, that should work:
python3 -c "from six.moves.urllib.request import urlopen"
python2 -c "from six.moves.urllib.request import urlopen"

and as per six doc:-
The urllib, urllib2, and urlparse modules have been combined in the urllib package in Python 3. The six.moves.urllib package is a version-independent location for this functionality; its structure mimics the structure of the Python 3 urllib package.


Thanks for the pointer, i will update the patch to use "six" instead.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-12-26 13:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2018-12-26 13:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

in Python 3 named urllib.request and urllib.error [1].

This patch makes code compatible for both python2 and
python3

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/urllib2.html

Change-Id: Ie9ebe0d1e39ddb4704df067d42915204e49821cf
Closes-Bug: #1809801
'}, {'created': '2018-12-26 13:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix python3 Compatibility for urllib2

in Python 3 named urllib.request and urllib.error [1].

This patch makes code compatible for both python2 and
python3 by using six.moves.urllib [2].

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/urllib2.html
[2] https://pythonhosted.org/six/

Change-Id: Ie9ebe0d1e39ddb4704df067d42915204e49821cf
Closes-Bug: #1809801
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python3 Compatibility for urllib2

The urllib2 module has been split across several modules
in Python 3 named urllib.request and urllib.error [1].

This patch makes code compatible for both python2 and
python3 by using six.moves.urllib [2].

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/urllib2.html
[2] https://pythonhosted.org/six/

Change-Id: Ie9ebe0d1e39ddb4704df067d42915204e49821cf
Closes-Bug: #1809801

commit_message:
Allow logical name in port creation

Currently a port can be created via a POST /v1/ports, with 'node_uuid'
and 'address' specified in the body. Now that we have logical names,
we should allow the port creation to accept the name of the node
instead of the UUID of the node. E.g. In request body pass "node_name"
instead of "node_uuid". The change also allows updating the port
with "node_name" in the request body via PATCH /v1/ports. Now either
"node_name" or "node_uuid" should be passed in the request body while
making a POST or PATCH API call.

Story: 1439901
Task: 10267
Change-Id: I89202f950674c0ee982ee1eef10f77d3c74b142d

commit_message:
Change session timeout to an idle timeout value

Add a new config SESSION_REFRESH (default True) which
turns SESSION_TIMEOUT into an idle timeout rather than
a hard timeout.

The existing hard timeout is awful UX, and while
SESSION_TIMEOUT could be set to a higher value, it
still makes for a somewhat unpleasant experience.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Icc6942e62c4e8d2fac57988b0a2233a8073b1944

A typo in the oslo.config 'choices' for the output_format config
option definition for the image conversion plugin in the
interoperable image import workflow prevents conversion to the
vmdk format.  This patch corrects the typo and regenerates the

commit_message:
Correct typo in config option choices

A typo in the oslo.config 'choices' for the output_format config
option definition for the image conversion plugin in the
interoperable image import workflow prevents conversion to the
vmdk format.  This patch corrects the typo and regenerates the
sample image import conf file.

Change-Id: I1836a46d969aab8ce09967db63d66f215d2cc920
Closes-bug: #1809462
Related-bug: #1805765

commit_message:
Add .stestr.conf configuration

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: I95a6d1135fb4861bd3fb2086ae7a63e486130db0
Closes-Bug: #1809062

commit_message:
Rework the overview of expiring objects

This is a reworked and slighly rewored version of
the expiring objects overview in the developer docs.

Mainly to attempt to explain the difference between
expirers defined in the object-server.conf and the
soon to be legacy object-expirer.conf.

This is a follow up to Kazuhiro's awesome work.

Change-Id: Ibee13a099c6871b2e0f2b7b394a631bc069e9ec4

commit_message:
Check if instance_id is not None

get_label returns instance_id that can be None [1].
It could lead to the exception [2]. The patch will
resolve it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/vitrage/datasources/prometheus/properties.py#L56
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/738265/

Change-Id: Ic914832fde53cd904bfc0e3313348d3025c69ca0

Change openstack-dev to openstack-discuss

Mailinglists have been updated. Openstack-discuss replaces
openstack-dev.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 16:43:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix jsonutils.to_primitive UserWarning

The CheatingSerializer fixture used in nova tests keeps
the RequestContext.db_connection set on the context object
which otherwise wouldn't normally happen. The context object
can show up in error notification payloads because of how
nova.exception_wrapper.wrap_exception works. That payload
is eventually serialized for notifications and since the
cheated RequestContext.db_connection is set and cannot be
serialized, it results in a UserWarning from the
jsonutils.to_primitive method (called via JsonPayloadSerializer).

This will eventually result in failures when that UserWarning
is made into an error.

To fix this, we can pass a fallback method to to_primitive()
which will serialize a RequestContext object the same way that
RequestContextSerializer serializes a context - by simply
converting it to dict form.

Since this only affects test runs, because of using the
CheatingSerializer fixture, it should have no impact on
runtime serializations.

The jsonutils.to_primitive() fallback method was added to
oslo.serialization via commit cdb2f60d26e3b65b6370f87b2e9864045651c117
in 2.21.1 so we have to bump our minimum required version
of that library as well.

Change-Id: Id9f960a0c7c8897dbb9edf53b4723154341412d6
Closes-Bug: #1799249
"}, {'created': '2018-10-22 16:45:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix jsonutils.to_primitive UserWarning

This will eventually result in failures when that UserWarning

To fix this, we can pass a fallback method to to_primitive()
which will serialize a RequestContext object the same way that
RequestContextSerializer serializes a context - by simply
converting it to dict form.

Since this only affects test runs, because of using the
CheatingSerializer fixture, it should have no impact on
runtime serializations.

Error logging is added to the FakeNotifier since it's hard
to know what is wrong in the payload unless it is logged.

Also, the WarningsFixture is updated to make sure we don't
introduce new UserWarnings for the serialization issue.

in 2.21.1 so we have to bump our minimum required version

commit_message:
Fix jsonutils.to_primitive UserWarning

The CheatingSerializer fixture used in nova tests keeps
the RequestContext.db_connection set on the context object
which otherwise wouldn't normally happen. The context object
can show up in error notification payloads because of how
nova.exception_wrapper.wrap_exception works. That payload
is eventually serialized for notifications and since the
cheated RequestContext.db_connection is set and cannot be
serialized, it results in a UserWarning from the
jsonutils.to_primitive method (called via JsonPayloadSerializer).

This will eventually result in failures when that UserWarning
is made into an error.

To fix this, we can pass a fallback method to to_primitive()
which will serialize a RequestContext object the same way that
RequestContextSerializer serializes a context - by simply
converting it to dict form.

Since this only affects test runs, because of using the
CheatingSerializer fixture, it should have no impact on
runtime serializations.

Error logging is added to the FakeNotifier since it's hard
to know what is wrong in the payload unless it is logged.

Also, the WarningsFixture is updated to make sure we don't
introduce new UserWarnings for the serialization issue.

The jsonutils.to_primitive() fallback method was added to
oslo.serialization via commit cdb2f60d26e3b65b6370f87b2e9864045651c117
in 2.21.1 so we have to bump our minimum required version
of that library as well.

Change-Id: Id9f960a0c7c8897dbb9edf53b4723154341412d6
Closes-Bug: #1799249

commit_message:
Redirect user/placement to placement docs

The placement api-ref had a link to user/placement.html in nova. That is
being fixed in Ibfe016f25a29b6810ea09c5d03a01dbf3c53371f but the link
is now loose in the internets, using the 'latest' prefix, so we want to
make sure that what is currently showing as a 404 goes somewhere useful,
in this case the top of the placement docs.

Change-Id: Ib75547ac655e614441dec5e1bcc7784c2b6a070c

commit_message:
Use oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures

Make use of the newer fixtures in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures
which is what was intended to supersede fixtures
in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base.

Change-Id: Icb88c13336fffb499083197ed864b8e4e45dc241
Closes-Bug: #1797102

commit_message:
Revert "temporarily turn off podman"

This reverts commit 6822ba9a7e264f0fbc454ce830483fd5e29358db.
We disabled the relabeling on /run/netns, it should
work better now.

It also properly enables podman on the overcloud without extra_args,
which will avoid issues when overriding the extra args.

Depends-On: I34813b240284c8d9b35e044bc9654d556ec0cbdb
Change-Id: Id75697e86cd5d08d116d6b074342801da4572f2f

commit_message:
overcloud-deploy: introduce overcloud_container_cli parameter

overcloud_container_cli is a new parameter that will be used by the
featuresets where podman is enabled on the overcloud.
The default is now set to 'docker' for backward compatibility but in
Stein we'll switch the default to Podman.

Change-Id: I34813b240284c8d9b35e044bc9654d556ec0cbdb

[{'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-25 10:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-11-25 11:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/619923/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 32m 47s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-25 13:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Same issues as commented here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409526/'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-25 14:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Same issues as commented here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409526/

What issues? I think I comment to all of you issues in that PS'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2018-11-25 15:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Please kindly check the zuul failings.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As commented in [1], you will duplicate the number of actual physical resources. You stated in [1] that those NICs have you PFs in the same PCI address, and the VFs created per PF (e.g., PF1: VF1,2,3 and PF2: VF4,5) will be seen in both PFs:
  PF1: VF1-5
  PF2: VF1-5
regardless of the actual PF assignation.

That means when you assign in you patch an embedded switch per PCI address, you will have, in the example given, 10 VFs per PCI address, instead of 5.

You stated the user will know this. This is true if the user needs to handle the VF ports, but not when using OpenStack. In OpenStack you will create two Neutron networks, one per physical network, each one connected to the physical ports (and PFs). When you create a port, you can selected the network (and thus the PF you want to use), but not the VF. Nothing prevents the user to create 5 ports per physical network. The problem here is:
- There is no way to specifically request a VF per PF or network.
- You can have ports assigned to PF1 but using VFs connected to PF2.
- If you try to bind a bound port, you will generate a configuration problem.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409526/'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:39:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm just blocking this patch because I see a flaw in the architecture, nothing else."}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> As commented in [1], you will duplicate the number of actual
 > physical resources. You stated in [1] that those NICs have you PFs
 > in the same PCI address, and the VFs created per PF (e.g., PF1:
 > VF1,2,3 and PF2: VF4,5) will be seen in both PFs:
 > PF1: VF1-5
 > PF2: VF1-5
 > regardless of the actual PF assignation.
 > 
 > That means when you assign in you patch an embedded switch per PCI
 > address, you will have, in the example given, 10 VFs per PCI
 > address, instead of 5.
 > 
 > You stated the user will know this. This is true if the user needs
 > to handle the VF ports, but not when using OpenStack. In OpenStack
 > you will create two Neutron networks, one per physical network,
 > each one connected to the physical ports (and PFs). When you create
 > a port, you can selected the network (and thus the PF you want to
 > use), but not the VF. Nothing prevents the user to create 5 ports

 > - If you try to bind a bound port, you will generate a
 > configuration problem.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409526/

that is not accurate. Let say I want configure 2 VF on PF1 and 3 VF on PF2. so if you do ip link show you will see 5 VF for PF 1 and 5 VF for PF2, but PF1 can only use VF 1-2 and PF2 can use 3-5 so there is not duplicate VF here. (when I write can use I mean the ip link set vf will succeed)'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-26 10:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > each one connected to the physical ports (and PFs). When you create
 > a port, you can selected the network (and thus the PF you want to

The nova whitelist should take care of this on the deployment phase, right?'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-26 11:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I need to see again on the ConnectX card behaves and get back to you'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-26 13:37:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Workflow

> As commented in [1], you will duplicate the number of actual
 > physical resources. You stated in [1] that those NICs have you PFs

 > use), but not the VF. Nothing prevents the user to create 5 ports
 > per physical network. The problem here is:
 > - There is no way to specifically request a VF per PF or network.
 > - You can have ports assigned to PF1 but using VFs connected to
 > PF2.
 > - If you try to bind a bound port, you will generate a
 > configuration problem.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409526/

@Rodolof, I check it again with the connectX and I don't see an issue. For nova perspective the pci_whitelist defines what pci address belongs to which physnet.  so if the cloud admin want to define the 2 port to 2 physnet he should map the VFs on the first belong to the first port to physnetA and the VF belongs to the second port to physnetB he should relay on the PF interface name in that case. Also I check the ip link command will set the correct VF even if you give it the other PF so there is not issue there and no duplicate resources. It is just a different way to configure the pci_whitelist which is already supported in nova see https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/liberty/approved/pci-passthrough-whitelist-regex.html"}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-26 14:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-11-26 15:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/619923/2 : FAILURE in 1h 32m 29s'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-11-26 22:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-11-27 00:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/619923/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 31m 00s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-27 13:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Moshe:

I remember your patch in Nova, and it's crucial for this patch. But not only we need to block, per PF, the VFs belonging to the other PF but also populating the parameter "excluded_devices":
    self.exclude_devices = config.parse_exclude_devices(
        cfg.CONF.SRIOV_NIC.exclude_devices)

Doing this, during the population of the ESwitchManager, we can build EmbSwitch objects with the correct list of VFs (and their PCI addresses). In other words: when executing EmbSwitch._load_devices(), we will read all VFs belonging to PF1 and PF2 (following the previous example). With excluded devices we'll skip, per PF, the VFs not assigned to those PFs.

I would:
- Add a release note (IMO, this change is important).
- Add an appendix in admin/config-sriov.rst: Nova and Neutron configs needed, use cases and HW affecting.
- In the code, check that, in this case (one PCI address, two or many EmbSwitch), none of the VFs present in EmbSwitch_1 is in EmbSwitch_2/etc'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-27 14:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > @Moshe:
 > 
 > I remember your patch in Nova, and it's crucial for this patch. But
 > not only we need to block, per PF, the VFs belonging to the other
 > PF but also populating the parameter "excluded_devices":
 > self.exclude_devices = config.parse_exclude_devices(
 > cfg.CONF.SRIOV_NIC.exclude_devices)
 > 
 > Doing this, during the population of the ESwitchManager, we can
 > build EmbSwitch objects with the correct list of VFs (and their PCI
 > addresses). In other words: when executing EmbSwitch._load_devices(),
 > we will read all VFs belonging to PF1 and PF2 (following the
 > previous example). With excluded devices we'll skip, per PF, the
 > VFs not assigned to those PFs.
 > 
 > I would:
 > - Add a release note (IMO, this change is important).
 > - Add an appendix in admin/config-sriov.rst: Nova and Neutron
 > configs needed, use cases and HW affecting.
 > - In the code, check that, in this case (one PCI address, two or
 > many EmbSwitch), none of the VFs present in EmbSwitch_1 is in
 > EmbSwitch_2/etc
I agree with adding the release note and config-sriov.rst, but regarding the third bullet there is a validation that when you select the pci_address it should also match the mac address of the port (which libvirt put it any way). So if we have EmbSwitch_1 and EmbSwitch_2 with the same VF then the code compare the mac address of the port to the VF. If it matches VF in EmbSwitch_1  it will use it and if it matches VF in EmbSwitch_2 it will that one.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-12-25 10:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Ok we will use exclude_devices instead of this patch. We will just update the doc on how to use it.'}]

commit_message:
Allow mapping of multiple Eswtich (PFs) to a PCI device

SR-IOV agent maps PCI device to one SR-IOV PF
we need to support multiple PF devices to one SR-IOV PCI device.

Change-Id: I7a2ba12c6dad6a2deb1d85a9d95cb9c1e2247869
Closes-Bug: #1649080

subject: Heartbeat ignores async actions
messages:
[{'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-02 20:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-03 06:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-03 11:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-04 20:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-05 07:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-06 05:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-12-25 09:10:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Vitalii, can you please explain more clearly the purpose of this change? Why do we need to care about asynchronous actions when checking heartbeats? I don't understand. The nature of asynchronous actions mean then they can be running for an undefined amount of time because they are processed by a 3rd party. And the 3rd party can't be responsible for sending heartbeats."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-02 20:27:37.000000000', 'message': 'Heartbeat ignores async actions

Before this patch, the heartbeat ignores asynchronous actions when it
extracts expired actions:
"query = query.filter_by(is_sync=True)"

Unlike synchronous actions, asynchronous actions remain in the RUNNING
state after the run method finishes. And it can be selected by heartbeat
mechanism after it leaves a mistral executor. To prevent it, a mistral
engine will change the last_heartbeat field of asynchronous action to
the max value. As a result of which, a heartbeat can't select a finished
asynchronous action execution.

We should always send a message of asynchronous action completion to
an engine, even the heartbeat is disabled. For example, the heartbeat
was disabled sometimes. After we turn on the heartbeat feature, it will
fail all asynchronous RUNNING actions.

If there are asynchronous actions in the RUNNING state, we change
"last_heartbeat" field to the max value during migration to prevent
their failure. I think "is_sync" column may still be useful in
the future. Because I don't add a drop query.

Change-Id: I4342eba7468e3bbb8f0c91d5741be0e49e0012ab
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Closes-Bug: #1790397
'}, {'created': '2018-09-03 06:27:44.000000000', 'message': 'Heartbeat ignores async actions

Before this patch, the heartbeat ignores asynchronous actions when it
extracts expired actions:
"query = query.filter_by(is_sync=True)"

Unlike synchronous actions, asynchronous actions remain in the RUNNING
state after the run method finishes. And it can be selected by heartbeat
mechanism after it leaves a mistral executor. To prevent it, a mistral
engine will change the last_heartbeat field of asynchronous action to
the max value. As a result of which, a heartbeat can't select a finished
asynchronous action execution.

We should always send a message of asynchronous action completion to
an engine, even the heartbeat is disabled. For example, the heartbeat
was disabled sometimes. After we turn on the heartbeat feature, it will
fail all asynchronous RUNNING actions.

If there are asynchronous actions in the RUNNING state, we change
"last_heartbeat" field to the max value during migration to prevent
their failure. I think "is_sync" column may still be useful in
the future. Because I don't add a drop query.

Change-Id: I4342eba7468e3bbb8f0c91d5741be0e49e0012ab
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Closes-Bug: #1790397
'}, {'created': '2018-09-04 20:18:59.000000000', 'message': 'Heartbeat ignores async actions

Before this patch, the heartbeat ignores asynchronous actions when it
extracts expired actions:
"query = query.filter_by(is_sync=True)"

Unlike synchronous actions, asynchronous actions remain in the RUNNING
state after the run method finishes. And it can be selected by heartbeat
mechanism after it leaves a mistral executor. To prevent it, a mistral
engine will change the last_heartbeat field of asynchronous action to
the max value. As a result of which, a heartbeat can't select a finished
asynchronous action execution.

We should always send a message of asynchronous action completion to
an engine, even the heartbeat is disabled. For example, the heartbeat
was disabled sometimes. After we turn on the heartbeat feature, it will
fail all asynchronous RUNNING actions.

If there are asynchronous actions in the RUNNING state, we change
"last_heartbeat" field to the max value during migration to prevent
their failure. I think "is_sync" column may still be useful in
the future. Because I don't add a drop query.

Change-Id: I4342eba7468e3bbb8f0c91d5741be0e49e0012ab
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Closes-Bug: #1790397
'}]
commit_message:
Heartbeat ignores async actions

Before this patch, the heartbeat ignores asynchronous actions when it
extracts expired actions:
"query = query.filter_by(is_sync=True)"

Unlike synchronous actions, asynchronous actions remain in the RUNNING
state after the run method finishes. And it can be selected by heartbeat
mechanism after it leaves a mistral executor. To prevent it, a mistral
engine will change the last_heartbeat field of asynchronous action to
the max value. As a result of which, a heartbeat can't select a finished
asynchronous action execution.

We should always send a message of asynchronous action completion to
an engine, even the heartbeat is disabled. For example, the heartbeat
was disabled sometimes. After we turn on the heartbeat feature, it will
fail all asynchronous RUNNING actions.

If there are asynchronous actions in the RUNNING state, we change
"last_heartbeat" field to the max value during migration to prevent
their failure. I think "is_sync" column may still be useful in
the future. Because I don't add a drop query.

Change-Id: I4342eba7468e3bbb8f0c91d5741be0e49e0012ab
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Closes-Bug: #1790397

subject: Use __slots__ for more yaqltypes
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-19 22:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2018-12-25 08:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 22:44:38.000000000', 'message': 'Use __slots__ for more yaqltypes

The change e693e6ecef9c331d4567c6708803e0d9cff1c15a added slots to the
concrete classes in yaqltypes, however the abstract parent classes
HiddenParameterType and LazyParameterType were omitted, with the result
that their derived types would still contain an __dict__ attribute.

Change-Id: I8e7335ced58b06cfd0de81ceb721dc2f8396f85f
'}]
commit_message:
Use __slots__ for more yaqltypes

The change e693e6ecef9c331d4567c6708803e0d9cff1c15a added slots to the
concrete classes in yaqltypes, however the abstract parent classes
HiddenParameterType and LazyParameterType were omitted, with the result
that their derived types would still contain an __dict__ attribute.

Change-Id: I8e7335ced58b06cfd0de81ceb721dc2f8396f85f

commit_message:
Allow setting quota of other tenants

Currently, the quota API/CLI allows users to set
quotas for current tenant only. However, admin
users needs the ability to set quota for other
tenants. For example:

   $ source /opt/stack/devstack/openrc admin admin
   $ openstack appcontainer quota update --containers 100 <DEMO_TENANT_UUID>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/627075
Change-Id: Ia147575d3e8d2c6d54bddd98846f0c9e3e518ec3
Related-Bug: #1807620

commit_message:
use neutron-lib for _model_query

The model_query module is in neutron-lib and the CommonDBMixin will
eventually be removed. This patch swiches use of the _model_query
method over to query_with_hooks from neutron-lib.

This patch also bumps the neutron-lib version up to 1.20.0

Change-Id: I8ff41c9d914b8329e4fca90de8a9ef9f41ccdcde

subject: Add scope checks to common system role definitions
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-18 21:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1806713 to implement-default-roles'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-12-20 07:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-12-25 04:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 20:55:59.000000000', 'message': "Add scope checks to common system role definitions

Until keystone defaults
``keystone.conf [oslo_policy] enforce_scope=True`` we really should
make sure we explicitly declare a system specific scope check in the
new system policies.

This is important because it prevents an authoritative regression when
operators upgrade. For example, if the identity:get_domain's current
check string is `rule:admin_require` and it's deprecated to be
`role:reader` with enforce_scope=True, then we've successfully exposed
more functionality to system users who have enforce_scope set to True.
If they don't, which is likely since enforce_scope defaults to False,
then it is possible for users with the reader role on a project to
access an API that was traditionally meant for only system
administrators. This is because oslo.policy will OR the old default
and the new default on upgrade to smooth the transition.

Note that the explicit scope checks in the actual check strings should
be removed once keystone sets enforce_scope = True by default. Until
then, we'll need to have something like this from opening up
administrative APIs.

Change-Id: I0e1f55dc6c18437b3356f9a2facfc95ecd1864e0
"}, {'created': '2018-12-18 21:50:23.000000000', 'message': "Add scope checks to common system role definitions

Until keystone defaults
``keystone.conf [oslo_policy] enforce_scope=True`` we really should
make sure we explicitly declare a system specific scope check in the
new system policies.

This is important because it prevents an authoritative regression when
operators upgrade. For example, if the identity:get_domain's current
check string is `rule:admin_require` and it's deprecated to be
`role:reader` with enforce_scope=True, then we've successfully exposed
more functionality to system users who have enforce_scope set to True.
If they don't, which is likely since enforce_scope defaults to False,
then it is possible for users with the reader role on a project to
access an API that was traditionally meant for only system
administrators. This is because oslo.policy will OR the old default
and the new default on upgrade to smooth the transition.

Note that the explicit scope checks in the actual check strings should
be removed once keystone sets enforce_scope = True by default. Until
then, we'll need to have something like this from opening up
administrative APIs.

Change-Id: I0e1f55dc6c18437b3356f9a2facfc95ecd1864e0
"}]
commit_message:
Add scope checks to common system role definitions

Until keystone defaults
``keystone.conf [oslo_policy] enforce_scope=True`` we really should
make sure we explicitly declare a system specific scope check in the
new system policies.

This is important because it prevents an authoritative regression when
operators upgrade. For example, if the identity:get_domain's current
check string is `rule:admin_require` and it's deprecated to be
`role:reader` with enforce_scope=True, then we've successfully exposed
more functionality to system users who have enforce_scope set to True.
If they don't, which is likely since enforce_scope defaults to False,
then it is possible for users with the reader role on a project to
access an API that was traditionally meant for only system
administrators. This is because oslo.policy will OR the old default
and the new default on upgrade to smooth the transition.

Note that the explicit scope checks in the actual check strings should
be removed once keystone sets enforce_scope = True by default. Until
then, we'll need to have something like this from opening up
administrative APIs.

Change-Id: I0e1f55dc6c18437b3356f9a2facfc95ecd1864e0

commit_message:
use payloads for ROUTER_INTERFACE BEFORE_DELETE events

This patch switches over to the payload style of callbacks by updating
neutron to callbacks to handle a DBEventPayload for BEFORE_DELETE events
of ROUTER_INTERFACE resources. See the depends on patch for more
details.

Also see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598347/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599034/

Change-Id: Ic14442ec8a53331a33d4b650347a359e63bc8814

[{'created': '2018-12-21 22:09:56.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: generalize rbd volume fallback removal statement

The warning being modified here was added in Pike:

  I6fc7108817fcd9df4a342c9dabbf14ab7911d06a

And then updated to say we would remove the fallback in
Queens:

  I006f41383dcef68d63a646665a56cbd4c3f93c4b

And here we're long past Queens and still have this old
warning with no immediate plans to do data migrations to
drop the fallback code, so this change simply makes the
warning message more generic.

Change-Id: Icdc02d0bbd023e916bd39945fe7afc52b7a3942c
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: generalize rbd volume fallback removal statement

The warning being modified here was added in Pike:

  I6fc7108817fcd9df4a342c9dabbf14ab7911d06a

And then updated to say we would remove the fallback in
Queens:

  I006f41383dcef68d63a646665a56cbd4c3f93c4b

And here we're long past Queens and still have this old
warning with no immediate plans to do data migrations to
drop the fallback code, so this change simply makes the
warning message more generic.

Change-Id: Icdc02d0bbd023e916bd39945fe7afc52b7a3942c

commit_message:
Allow setting quota of other tenants

Currently, the quota API/CLI allows users to set
quotas for current tenant only. However, admin
users needs the ability to set quota for other
tenants. For example:

  $ source /opt/stack/devstack/openrc admin admin
  $ openstack appcontainer quota update --containers 100 <DEMO_TENANT_UUID>

Closes-Bug: #1807620
Change-Id: I9109d968d8010692644fd004a8085a43e1bdf60f

[{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:55:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This patch will break some existing consumers; those who are not part of neutron-lib-current and are thus not up to date with neutron-lib consumption. While this in itself is as expected, there's a cascading effect for any projects that depend on these consumers who will break.


The cascading effect is as follows:
- Some neutron-lib-current consumers depend on other networking projects that are not current.
- When these depended upon projects break (because they are not current) it will in turn affect the neutron-lib-current consumers as the code from the non-current consumer will break.


As a result we need to figure out what we want to do here before proceeding. I will queue up a discussion on the topic as it's an important and widespread issue we'll have to deal with."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-31 18:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

I'll deal with the osprofiler stuff in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615585 (since we need it for the performance work we are doing in the performance subteam) and you deal with the context manager in this patch"}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-11-20 18:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I propose we move forward with this patch.
Of our active consumers [1], the only one left is BGPVPN [2].
There's been a consumption patch for BGPVPN out for long time [3], which hasn't merged because their gate has been broken for about a month now [4].
I've spoke to BGPVPN core's and the agreement was to move forward this week if their gate wasn't fixed.


Once BGPVPN gets their gate working, they can just land [3] to get up to speed.


[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron-lib-current&i=nope&files=&repos=
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.context_manager&i=nope&files=&repos=
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613995/

commit_message:
remove context_manager from neutron

The context_manager is already in neutron-lib and being used by our
active consumers either directly or via the current shim we have
in neutron.db.api.context_manager that just references that in lib.
This patch removes the context_manager from neutron and updates the UTs
that mock it.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ia5191a71b377e2862592a09da8dc3a5d415de9aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 13:48:19.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback, however, results in the
mismatched use of cinder auth_username with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes the fallback path to use nova auth_username with nova
rbd_secret_uuid.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
'}, {'created': '2018-12-21 20:56:55.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

commit_message:
Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454

[{'created': '2018-12-17 22:52:32.000000000', 'message': 'Properly log request headers in metadata API

Currently we log the request headers in the metadata
API in a useless form:

  DEBUG nova.api.metadata.handler [None \
  req-4b5eab00-e132-4551-b7f8-c80a238727a2 None None] \
  Metadata request headers: <webob.headers.EnvironHeaders object \
  at 0x7f2d6fdb5e90> {{(pid=9311) __call__ \
  /opt/stack/nova/nova/api/metadata/handler.py:99}}

This change builds a dict from the headers and then
also masks any sensitive information before logging it,
but only does this if debug logging is enabled.

commit_message:
Properly log request headers in metadata API

Currently we log the request headers in the metadata
API in a useless form:

  DEBUG nova.api.metadata.handler [None \
  req-4b5eab00-e132-4551-b7f8-c80a238727a2 None None] \
  Metadata request headers: <webob.headers.EnvironHeaders object \
  at 0x7f2d6fdb5e90> {{(pid=9311) __call__ \
  /opt/stack/nova/nova/api/metadata/handler.py:99}}

This change builds a dict from the headers and then
also masks any sensitive information before logging it,
but only does this if debug logging is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1808879

Change-Id: I609d96293f7e77f59df3f33240f5fc4bb72470d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 07:46:05.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I905e18a05131e1a2d20016721ef3d46cc8fbe672
'}, {'created': '2018-12-24 09:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I905e18a05131e1a2d20016721ef3d46cc8fbe672
'}, {'created': '2018-12-24 09:27:53.000000000', 'message': 'update tox python3 overrides


Change-Id: I905e18a05131e1a2d20016721ef3d46cc8fbe672
'}]

commit_message:
Final release note for versioned notification transformation

As the last versioned notification transformation patch
I019e88fabd1d386c0d6395a7b1969315873485fd has been merged
this patch adds a release note that the versioned interface is
complete.

Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-stein

commit_message:
Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (8)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the LibvirtVolumeSnapshotTestCase class
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* test_volume_snapshot_delete_relative_2
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_outer_success
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_outer_failure
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_invalid_type
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_netdisk_1
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_netdisk_relative_1
* test_volume_snapshot_delete_netdisk_relative_2

This patch completes replacing mox in the file.

Change-Id: Id9184c4ef301ef48534e4c104b073a2d3731133b
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-stein

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-03 23:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (7)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the following classes
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* LibvirtVolumeUsageTestCase
  - test_get_all_volume_usage
  - test_get_all_volume_usage_device_not_found

* LibvirtNonblockingTestCase
  - test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt

* LibvirtVolumeSnapshotTestCase
  - _test_volume_snapshot_create
  - test_volume_snapshot_create_libgfapi
  - test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_failure
  - test_volume_snapshot_delete_1
  - test_volume_snapshot_delete_relative_1

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I8f0deb4fcd1ef063752e8250c6b13bf9275e5204
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (7)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the following classes
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* LibvirtVolumeUsageTestCase
  - test_get_all_volume_usage
  - test_get_all_volume_usage_device_not_found

* LibvirtNonblockingTestCase
  - test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt

* LibvirtVolumeSnapshotTestCase
  - _test_volume_snapshot_create
  - test_volume_snapshot_create_libgfapi
  - test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_failure
  - test_volume_snapshot_delete_1
  - test_volume_snapshot_delete_relative_1

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I8f0deb4fcd1ef063752e8250c6b13bf9275e5204
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-stein

Change-Id: I163c417375678b428ac77aac87ccafaf1f6186ab
Closes-Bug: #1795425
'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 15:41:37.000000000', 'message': 'Do not encode server create location response header

should be treated as native `str` (whatever the Python version).

Change-Id: I163c417375678b428ac77aac87ccafaf1f6186ab

'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 21:39:02.000000000', 'message': "Clean up header encoding handling in compute API

PEP 3333[1] says request and response headers (within the application)
should be treated as native `str` (whatever the Python version). It's
the job of the WSGI server to translate from `str` to reasonable output
on the outgoing socket connection.

This was already mostly correct but two issues were discovered while
trying to create integration tests that use the value of the location
response header when POSTing to create a server. In python2 it was
working. In Python3 the header had a value of

location: http://192.168.1.76/compute/v2.1/b'http:/192.168.1.76/compute/v2.1/servers/fad04042-850b-443a-9e48-773111cbc981'

(note the b'...' bounding the full url on the end).

This was happening for two reasons:

* nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py independently encodes the
  location header to utf-8, instead of using the centralized handling
  in nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py

  This meant that the value of the location header would arrive, in
  Python 3, at the centralized handling as a bytestring.

* The centralized handling in nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py was incorrectly
  using the six.text_type() method. That is simply an alias to unicode
  in python 2 and str in python3. In python3 when given a bytestring
  as the only argument object.__str()__ is called on the argument.
  Which yields b'whatever'.

At that stage, the handling in the web server which processes a location
header to check for the presence of a host and prefix already at the
start of the provided location will find b'...' and do a concatenation
without any replace.

So, because of all that, this patch includes three changes:

* The server creation location header code does no encoding and relies
  on the centralized handling.

* The centralized handling removes the use of text_type() as a function
  because that is redundant with the safe_encode and safe_decode changes
  in the same loop.

* Doc strings and comments in the ResponseObject are clarified with
  regard to this encoding topic.

Tests for the internal production of the location header are adjusted
to reflect these changes.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/#a-note-on-string-types

Change-Id: I163c417375678b428ac77aac87ccafaf1f6186ab
Closes-Bug: #1795425

(note the b'...' bounding the full url on the end).

This was happening for two reasons:

  This meant that the value of the location header would arrive, in

  using the six.text_type() method. That is simply an alias to unicode
  in python 2 and str in python3. In python3 when given a bytestring
  as the only argument object.__str()__ is called on the argument.
  Which yields b'whatever'.

At that stage, the handling in the web server which processes a location
header to check for the presence of a host and prefix already at the
start of the provided location will find b'...' and do a concatenation
without any replace.

So, because of all that, this patch includes three changes:

* The server creation location header code does no encoding and relies
  on the centralized handling.

* The centralized handling removes the use of text_type() as a function
  because that is redundant with the safe_encode and safe_decode changes
  in the same loop.

* Doc strings and comments in the ResponseObject are clarified with
  regard to this encoding topic.

Also, comments in Resource._process_stack are updated to correspond with
the changes above. The code is not changed, as they are already doing
the right thing: The comment was misrepresenting what was going on.
There is some duplication of code between these two areas, but the code
is too inscrutable for me to be willing to change a part that isn't
presenting an explicit bug.

Tests for the internal production of the location header are adjusted
to reflect these changes.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/#a-note-on-string-types

Change-Id: I163c417375678b428ac77aac87ccafaf1f6186ab
Closes-Bug: #1795425

commit_message:
Clean up header encoding handling in compute API

PEP 3333[1] says request and response headers (within the application)
should be treated as native `str` (whatever the Python version). It's
the job of the WSGI server to translate from `str` to reasonable output
on the outgoing socket connection.

This was already mostly correct but two issues were discovered while
trying to create integration tests that use the value of the location
response header when POSTing to create a server. In python2 it was
working. In Python3 the header had a value of

location: http://192.168.1.76/compute/v2.1/b'http:/192.168.1.76/compute/v2.1/servers/fad04042-850b-443a-9e48-773111cbc981'

(note the b'...' bounding the full url on the end).

This was happening for two reasons:

* nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py independently encodes the
  location header to utf-8, instead of using the centralized handling
  in nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py

  This meant that the value of the location header would arrive, in
  Python 3, at the centralized handling as a bytestring.

* The centralized handling in nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py was incorrectly
  using the six.text_type() method. That is simply an alias to unicode
  in python 2 and str in python3. In python3 when given a bytestring
  as the only argument object.__str()__ is called on the argument.
  Which yields b'whatever'.

At that stage, the handling in the web server which processes a location
header to check for the presence of a host and prefix already at the
start of the provided location will find b'...' and do a concatenation
without any replace.

So, because of all that, this patch includes three changes:

* The server creation location header code does no encoding and relies
  on the centralized handling.

* The centralized handling removes the use of text_type() as a function
  because that is redundant with the safe_encode and safe_decode changes
  in the same loop.

* Doc strings and comments in the ResponseObject are clarified with
  regard to this encoding topic.

Also, comments in Resource._process_stack are updated to correspond with
the changes above. The code is not changed, as they are already doing
the right thing: The comment was misrepresenting what was going on.
There is some duplication of code between these two areas, but the code
is too inscrutable for me to be willing to change a part that isn't
presenting an explicit bug.

Tests for the internal production of the location header are adjusted
to reflect these changes.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/#a-note-on-string-types

Change-Id: I163c417375678b428ac77aac87ccafaf1f6186ab
Closes-Bug: #1795425

Change-Id: I26d58e8156b209c26d01da0baf7137d33eda4307
'}]
commit_message:
Drop old service version check compat from _delete_while_booting

Like change I11083aa3c78bd8b6201558561457f3d65007a177 the API
should not need to have compatibility code for mitaka-era
services, so this drops the service version check from the
_delete_while_booting method.

Change-Id: I26d58e8156b209c26d01da0baf7137d33eda4307

commit_message:
Remove "API Service Version" upgrade check

With change I11083aa3c78bd8b6201558561457f3d65007a177
the code for the API Service Version upgrade check no
longer exists and therefore the upgrade check itself
is meaningless now.

Change-Id: I68b13002bc745c2c9ca7209b806f08c30272550e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 01:39:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "Resource Providers" upgrade check

With placement being extracted from nova, the
"Resource Providers" nova-status upgrade check no
longer works as intended since the placement data
will no longer be in the nova_api database. As a
result the check can fail on otherwise properly
deployed setups with placement extracted.

This check was originally intended to ease the upgrade
to Ocata when placement was required for nova to work,
as can be seen from the newton/ocata/pike references
in the code.

Note that one could argue the check itself as a concept
is still useful for fresh installs to make sure everything
is deployed correctly and nova-compute is properly
reporting into placement, but for it to be maintained
we would have to change it to no longer rely on the
nova_api database and instead use the placement REST API,
which while possible, might not be worth the effort or
maintenance cost.

For simplicity and expediency, the check is simply removed
in this change.

Related mailing list discussion can be found here [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000454.html

Change-Id: I630a518d449a64160c81410245a22ed3d985fb01
Closes-Bug: #1808956
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "Resource Providers" upgrade check

With placement being extracted from nova, the
"Resource Providers" nova-status upgrade check no
longer works as intended since the placement data
will no longer be in the nova_api database. As a
result the check can fail on otherwise properly
deployed setups with placement extracted.

This check was originally intended to ease the upgrade
to Ocata when placement was required for nova to work,
as can be seen from the newton/ocata/pike references
in the code.

Note that one could argue the check itself as a concept
is still useful for fresh installs to make sure everything
is deployed correctly and nova-compute is properly
reporting into placement, but for it to be maintained
we would have to change it to no longer rely on the
nova_api database and instead use the placement REST API,
which while possible, might not be worth the effort or
maintenance cost.

For simplicity and expediency, the check is simply removed
in this change.

Related mailing list discussion can be found here [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000454.html

Change-Id: I630a518d449a64160c81410245a22ed3d985fb01
Closes-Bug: #1808956
