commit_message:
Remove NovaException logging from scatter_gather_cells

With change I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf
the caller of the various scatter_gatter functions can
get any exception result and decide what kind of logging
is necessary, so this change removes the logging from
the scatter_gather_cells method **for NovaExceptions**.
This is needed because of change
Iaea1cb4ed93bb98f451de4f993106d7891ca3682 where
showing a server which is deleted, which results in an
InstanceNotFound exception, gets logged as an exception
in the nova-api logs and shouldn't be.

Non-NovaExceptions will still get logged as before since
those are likely due to unexpected errors, like DBErrors.

Change-Id: I930ee897c46385c3c9719b393753c4484caf909f
Closes-Bug: #1804325

fault.format_message() would return the exception message[1] but until now, there was no guarantee that this would be a string, breaking the utils.safe_truncate call.

Indeed, but there are many more situations like this, here are a few: [1][2].

As I was mentioning in the commit message, it may be quite difficult to find all the places in which this happens, especially as we don't have 100% test coverage. IMO, it's safer and more convenient to just convert the exception messages here. Plus, you no longer have to do things like "raise SomeException(six.text_type(other_exception))".

Exception messages are expected to be strings, but it's not always
the case. Some exceptions are wrapped and passed as new exception
messages, which affects some exception handlers.

Finding all the occurrences may be difficult. For now, it's easier

commit_message:
Convert exception messages to strings

Exception messages are expected to be strings, but it's not always
the case. Some exceptions are wrapped and passed as new exception
messages, which affects some exception handlers.

Finding all the occurrences may be difficult. For now, it's easier
to just convert the exception messages to strings in the NovaException
class.

Closes-Bug: #1801713

Change-Id: Ic470791aa2b08ca9911bf70cb3cc68652d3647f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 21:40:58.000000000', 'message': '[CEPH] Fix a race condition with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions udev may not have created the required
devices, leading to the helm chart zapping a fully working OSD disk.
Add partprobe and a udev settle to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I807074c4c5e54b953b5c0efa4c169763c5629062
'}, {'created': '2018-12-21 01:42:58.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Fix a race condition with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions there is a race condition with lsblk
causing the helm chart to zap a fully working OSD disk. We refactor
the code to remove this requirement and add partprobe/udev settle to
ensure all disk devices and partitionsare present.

Change-Id: I807074c4c5e54b953b5c0efa4c169763c5629062
'}, {'created': '2018-12-21 05:56:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Fix a race condition with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions there is a race condition with lsblk
causing the helm chart to zap a fully working OSD disk. We refactor
the code to remove this requirement.

Change-Id: I807074c4c5e54b953b5c0efa4c169763c5629062
'}, {'created': '2018-12-21 17:24:00.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Fix race conditions with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions there is a race condition with lsblk
causing the helm chart to zap a fully working OSD disk. We refactor
the code to remove this requirement.

Additonally the new automatic journal partitioning code has a race
condition in which the same journal partition could be picked twice
for OSDs on the same node. To resolve this we share a common tmp
directory from the node to all of the OSD pods on that node.

Change-Id: I807074c4c5e54b953b5c0efa4c169763c5629062
'}, {'created': '2018-12-21 17:37:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Fix race conditions with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions there is a race condition with lsblk
causing the helm chart to zap a fully working OSD disk. We refactor
the code to remove this requirement.

Additonally the new automatic journal partitioning code has a race
condition in which the same journal partition could be picked twice

commit_message:
[CEPH] Fix race conditions with OSD POD initialization

Under POD restart conditions there is a race condition with lsblk
causing the helm chart to zap a fully working OSD disk. We refactor
the code to remove this requirement.

Additonally the new automatic journal partitioning code has a race
condition in which the same journal partition could be picked twice
for OSDs on the same node. To resolve this we share a common tmp
directory from the node to all of the OSD pods on that node.

Change-Id: I807074c4c5e54b953b5c0efa4c169763c5629062

subject: Add compute_flavor field to amphora
messages:
[{'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-09 11:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-09 12:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

output example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/736868/'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-09 12:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I intentionally did not add compute flavor to the amphora list output. Let me know if you disagree and think it should be a part of it.'}, {'account_id': 28377, 'date': '2018-12-10 13:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I would be more interested having ability to filter by compute_flavor than having them into amphora list output'}, {'account_id': 28329, 'date': '2018-12-11 10:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Currently, the compute flavor of amphora is specified via a configuration file which means the compute flavor is uniform. But, In the future, We may support to specify compute flavor via Octavia provider flavor.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-12-11 23:27:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I still think it's good info. Operator might change the flavor field in the config but the amps with the old flavor are still present. That is helpful if you need to failover amps (e.g. to evacuate a part of your DC)"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-12-24 18:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> I would be more interested having ability to filter by
 > compute_flavor than having them into amphora list output

This patch adds compute_flavor to the amphora show. It will not be shown by amphora list.'}]

commit_message:
Update the nspawn unit services

This change updates the unit file for systemd-nspawn to allow it to
better confine containers and have them reliabily start/stop on host
restart.

Change-Id: I3c7a07a94c94a81ac8380a4e336cf744615a6b5b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See failure to add pre-commit on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625997/1 because pre-commit is not yet listed in blacklist.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-12-19 10:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-12-19 15:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How is this being used? It feels like a developer tool, rather than something that interacts with CI or some other part of the testing infrastructure. What am I missing?'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-12-19 15:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug, pre-commit counts as a linter, mostly is a meta-linter (like our hacking).

Its name pre-commit confuses lots of people because they assume it is only a hook. Yes it can optionally install commit hooks, but that's only an option. It can be used as a normal linter inside tox.

Example use at https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/tox.ini#L46

Better to checkput the code and run "tox -e linters" to see it exactly  how it works.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:52:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-12-24 14:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 1697b579aa164ab0baeb89c3e06193244c9bccfc'}]

[{'created': '2018-12-18 20:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'Adds pre-commit linter to the blacklist

Avoids check-requirements failure on projects using pre-commit, like
tripleo ones.

Change-Id: Idc1e76e178e63cc0efa5279f779a18dac18a1bc7
'}]
commit_message:
Adds pre-commit linter to the blacklist

Avoids check-requirements failure on projects using pre-commit, like
tripleo ones.

Change-Id: Idc1e76e178e63cc0efa5279f779a18dac18a1bc7

commit_message:
Support enable/disable uplink status propagation

Add options to enable/disable uplink status propagation on creating
a neutron port.

Related patches:
* neutron: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571899/
* openstacksdk: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586687/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586687/
Change-Id: I095a98fc5f5aee62d979a16b3cd79d91ec3b9ddb
Related-Bug: #1722720

Changes reverted'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-20 16:45:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I'm good with this as a direct conversion without any other changes. We haven't introduced any problems that didn't already exist.

I will note that there doesn't seem to be a _need_ for this. Even the followup patch doesn't actually use any oslo.config-specific functionality for argument parsing, it just adds a ConfigOpts object inside the fake enforcer, which could have been done using argparse as the top-level parser too.

That said, this is a valid use of oslo.config and the patch is already written so I'm fine with it."}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-12-24 09:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use oslo.config instead of argparse.

Changing arg consumption from argparse to oslo.config in
order to also provide behavior control using config files.

Change-Id: Iec4dab763b973b70c98077cb29708acd9cbbcec4
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 07:48:29.000000000', 'message': "Actually test child SIGHUP signal

The intention of this test was to wait 5s after sending SIGHUP to a
child process to make sure that it doesn't exit. However, due to a logic
error, it just stopped checking and declared success immediately. Fix
the logic so that we have a better chance of seeing if SIGHUP
incorrectly kills the process.

Change-Id: I1f320a8dfdd7a922b461d070491ad53e6cd2b20d
Related-Bug: #1803731
"}]
commit_message:
Actually test child SIGHUP signal

The intention of this test was to wait 5s after sending SIGHUP to a
child process to make sure that it doesn't exit. However, due to a logic
error, it just stopped checking and declared success immediately. Fix
the logic so that we have a better chance of seeing if SIGHUP
incorrectly kills the process.

Change-Id: I1f320a8dfdd7a922b461d070491ad53e6cd2b20d
Related-Bug: #1803731

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 08:54:45.000000000', 'message': "Add judgment when getting resource_name

If glance does not have any resource type association，we will get
IndexError when getting resource_name from list_resource_types's
response body because the response body does not have any resource_types.

This patch fixes this bug with the following method:
Adding judgment whether the list_resource_types's response body contains
resource_types before getting resource_name.If there is no resource_types,
we shoule set one initialized resource_name to get the test going on.

Change-Id: Ifab51f54aed9d8ec5473c5ce229a367327c77e2b
Closes-Bug: #1807559
"}, {'created': '2018-12-14 15:03:34.000000000', 'message': "Add judgment when getting resource_name

response body because the response body does not have any resource_types.

This patch fixes this bug with the following method:
Adding judgment whether the list_resource_types's response body contains
resource_types before getting resource_name.If there is no resource_types,
we shoule set one initialized resource_name to get the test going on.

Change-Id: Ifab51f54aed9d8ec5473c5ce229a367327c77e2b
Closes-Bug: #1807559
"}]
commit_message:
Add judgment when getting resource_name

If glance does not have any resource type association，we will get
IndexError when getting resource_name from list_resource_types's
response body because the response body does not have any resource_types.

This patch fixes this bug with the following method:
Adding judgment whether the list_resource_types's response body contains
resource_types before getting resource_name.If there is no resource_types,
we shoule set one initialized resource_name to get the test going on.

Change-Id: Ifab51f54aed9d8ec5473c5ce229a367327c77e2b
Closes-Bug: #1807559

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 16:25:20.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6d0cb960ee303dd96ca10d9177ddfb979dfbb60a

subject: This commit extends the l2pop rpc handles to allow an agent to query the full FDB for a list of network_id values. This is needed by the dynamic-routing agent to get a full FDB snapshot whenever it restarts.  This is not needed by normal layer2 agents because the l2pop mechanism driver is able to detect whenever the first port comes up on an agent and therefore knows when to send the full FDB. Since the dynamic-routing agent has not ports bound to it the l2pop mechanism driver does not any trigger to send this information to it. Adding a extension registration mechanism so that other subprojects can  extend the information included in a full FDB messages before it is sent to the agent.  At this time it will be used by BGPVPN to add information that was learned from peer BGP routers.

- neutron-tempest-plugin-api: unrecognized error

- openstack-tox-py27: unrecognized error
- openstack-tox-py35: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-py3: unrecognized error

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 06:42:15.000000000', 'message': ' This commit extends the l2pop rpc handles to allow an agent to query the full FDB for a list of network_id values. This is needed by the dynamic-routing agent to get a full FDB snapshot whenever it restarts.  This is not needed by normal layer2 agents because the l2pop mechanism driver is able to detect whenever the first port comes up on an agent and therefore knows when to send the full FDB. Since the dynamic-routing agent has not ports bound to it the l2pop mechanism driver does not any trigger to send this information to it.
Adding a extension registration mechanism so that other subprojects can  extend the information included in a full FDB messages before it is sent to the agent.  At this time it will be used by BGPVPN to add information that was learned from peer BGP routers.

Change-Id: I3acfd3c24c5042fc9c706b17cfaf30f3a593cc56
'}]
commit_message:
This commit extends the l2pop rpc handles to allow an agent to query the full FDB for a list of network_id values. This is needed by the dynamic-routing agent to get a full FDB snapshot whenever it restarts.  This is not needed by normal layer2 agents because the l2pop mechanism driver is able to detect whenever the first port comes up on an agent and therefore knows when to send the full FDB. Since the dynamic-routing agent has not ports bound to it the l2pop mechanism driver does not any trigger to send this information to it.
Adding a extension registration mechanism so that other subprojects can  extend the information included in a full FDB messages before it is sent to the agent.  At this time it will be used by BGPVPN to add information that was learned from peer BGP routers.

Change-Id: I3acfd3c24c5042fc9c706b17cfaf30f3a593cc56

commit_message:
Fix Vitrage wrong configuration

* In service_credentials section, project_name should be
admin and auth_url should use keystone public port (5000)
according [1].
* User vitrage should have role admin in project admin [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L164
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/install/install-rdo.html#initialize-vitrage

Change-Id: I8bf028c702df5659e4c58df0e17600ab5be14eea

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 16:21:49.000000000', 'message': 'Continue bringing up interfaces even if one fails

Currently os-net-config exits immediately if an interface fails to
come up.  This causes problems when we call it with a failsafe
configuration because it can result in working interfaces not
being configured if there are also non-functional interfaces, which
can leave a system unreachable over the network even though it may
have a working connection.

This change stores errors and handles them after all interfaces have
been processed to allow os-net-config to do what it can even with an
invalid configuration.  If any failures are detected it will still
cause os-net-config to report failure at the end.

Change-Id: I3bc75e217d0b7c5ae62900f4253ad57ee3720685
Closes-Bug: 1692725
(cherry picked from commit 5c840c4941d8401ee3c2d15c9a6cfb4f6a074deb)
'}]
commit_message:
Continue bringing up interfaces even if one fails

Currently os-net-config exits immediately if an interface fails to
come up.  This causes problems when we call it with a failsafe
configuration because it can result in working interfaces not
being configured if there are also non-functional interfaces, which
can leave a system unreachable over the network even though it may
have a working connection.

This change stores errors and handles them after all interfaces have
been processed to allow os-net-config to do what it can even with an
invalid configuration.  If any failures are detected it will still
cause os-net-config to report failure at the end.

Change-Id: I3bc75e217d0b7c5ae62900f4253ad57ee3720685
Closes-Bug: 1692725
(cherry picked from commit 5c840c4941d8401ee3c2d15c9a6cfb4f6a074deb)

commit_message:
Adds a certificates configuration guide

This patch adds an administrator guide that describes the process for
setting up a dual certificate authority configuration for Octavia.

Change-Id: Ibe236a851833ffa24c19695ef67547b504453f9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-07 07:55:03.000000000', 'message': "Add updated_at check for update_aggregates in scheduler

In some case, the aggregate's operation sequence on DB may
not exactly as same as on scheduler.
For example:
Operations on DB:
1. add host
2. delete host

However, on scheduler, if the operation's sequence reversed as:
1. delete host
2. add host
It will case the DB/scheduler outer-sync.

To resolve this, if the timestamp of update_aggregates is old than
existing aggregate, pass this update.

Change-Id: Iedebe508f4c4178a202619f00430995be07cf76b
Closes-bug: #1542491
"}, {'created': '2016-03-08 01:23:52.000000000', 'message': "Add updated_at check for update_aggregates in scheduler

In some case, the aggregate's operation sequence on DB may
not exactly as same as on scheduler.
For example:
Operations on DB:
1. add host
2. delete host

However, on scheduler, if the operation's sequence reversed as:
1. delete host
2. add host
It will case the DB/scheduler outer-sync.

To resolve this, if the timestamp of update_aggregates is old than
existing aggregate, pass this update.

Change-Id: Iedebe508f4c4178a202619f00430995be07cf76b
Closes-bug: #1542491
"}]
commit_message:
Add updated_at check for update_aggregates in scheduler

In some case, the aggregate's operation sequence on DB may
not exactly as same as on scheduler.
For example:
Operations on DB:
1. add host
2. delete host

However, on scheduler, if the operation's sequence reversed as:
1. delete host
2. add host
It will case the DB/scheduler outer-sync.

To resolve this, if the timestamp of update_aggregates is old than
existing aggregate, pass this update.

Change-Id: Iedebe508f4c4178a202619f00430995be07cf76b
Closes-bug: #1542491

commit_message:
Support delete messages with claim_ids

This patch will implement to delete messages with claim_ids
when option 'message_delete_with_claim_id' is True.

This will improve the security of the message avoiding
delete messages before they're claimed and handled.

Change-Id: Ib7ef8ff74c87c8629412af8ceb53b314ed0ca071
Implements: bp delete-message-with-claim-id

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-17 14:55:23.000000000', 'message': 'Lift the limit on ntp servers

We accept multiple servers from the config but were only using the first
one which can lead to ntp failures. We should be using the complete list
provided by the end user.

Change-Id: If2fd70253b8ad949825f2636bce80d5851851b1f
Closes-Bug: #1806521
(cherry picked from commit e9c907a9229f6b79a4063facaea9411e30a054f6)
'}]
commit_message:
Lift the limit on ntp servers

We accept multiple servers from the config but were only using the first
one which can lead to ntp failures. We should be using the complete list
provided by the end user.

Change-Id: If2fd70253b8ad949825f2636bce80d5851851b1f
Closes-Bug: #1806521
(cherry picked from commit e9c907a9229f6b79a4063facaea9411e30a054f6)

commit_message:
Add python interpreter to ansible postconfig

In order to specify which version of python we should use for the
deployment, we need to pass in the python interpreter into the
postconfig where we are directly calling the ansible heat hook.

Change-Id: I9dfc72269f800395a9864c457a5a43f7590c8e75
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

subject: Api-worker sync threads - lock graph from changing during API calls.
messages:
[{'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2018-12-20 12:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-21 20:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I could be wrong (and, in a current case, I hope I am), but it seems like a wrong solution.

It works only if we've got workers on the same node. It's not scalable. To fix this
we need some distributed locks like tooz[1]. tooz can be also used for local locks on the one node.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tooz"}, {'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2018-12-23 07:29:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I will fix my commit message."}, {'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2018-12-23 07:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-12-23 11:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Api-worker sync threads - lock graph from changing during API calls.

Adding synchronization of threads in api-workers.
We want to block graph updates thread to change the graph while an api
thread is running.
In init of each api worker, we creates a thread lock.
acquired before and released after ech api call.
The same lock is acquired before and released after each update to the 
graph.

Also, main process updates are now async
(sent to a queue, without waiting/joining for a reply).
This is to make sure api calls do not delay the main process processor.

Change-Id: I5b0e580f5bc61006299172f23c523b2641c30de6

to ceilometer with rpc.
the backup.createprogress notification seems to be leaking which

commit_message:
Tests : notifier problem with backup

There appears to be a race condition while sending notifications
to ceilometer with rpc.
the backup.createprogress notification seems to be leaking which
appears to be the main cause of the failures.
This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I460a270eba61cdca131717f7dfe726841a509378
Closes-Bug: #1803648

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-15 07:50:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix the bug about DHCP port whose network has multiple subnets.

When a subnet's enable_dhcp attribute is updated, we must restart
dhcp device. So,when we decide whether 'restart' or
'reload_allocations' in refresh_dhcp_helper function we only compare
the cidr of subnets which enabled dhcp.

The previous logic only calls 'restart' when deleting or adding a
subnet. This may cause the dhcp port not updated when the subnet's
enable_dhcp is updated to True.

Change-Id: Ic547946ac786c5fab82b4ee7078bf86483f51eb5
Closes-Bug: #1805824
(cherry picked from commit 9aa7af82210f1ffb6274399648962b65162e17d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug about DHCP port whose network has multiple subnets.

When a subnet's enable_dhcp attribute is updated, we must restart
dhcp device. So,when we decide whether 'restart' or
'reload_allocations' in refresh_dhcp_helper function we only compare
the cidr of subnets which enabled dhcp.

The previous logic only calls 'restart' when deleting or adding a
subnet. This may cause the dhcp port not updated when the subnet's
enable_dhcp is updated to True.

Change-Id: Ic547946ac786c5fab82b4ee7078bf86483f51eb5
Closes-Bug: #1805824
(cherry picked from commit 9aa7af82210f1ffb6274399648962b65162e17d1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-22 21:01:14.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to run pep8/docs tox env with horizon plugins

As of now, when horizon plugins are configured in the horizon repo,
pep8 and docs tox env cannot run.
This is because openstack_dashboard.settings tries to load horizon plugins
but horizon plugins are not installed in tox env by default and
the jobs will fail as a result.
This commit changes to use openstack_dashboard.test.settings
as DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE for these tox environments by default.

Change-Id: I6a9d0c74271cc4addd8a0964b5955d7d3b6d8267
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to run pep8/docs tox env with horizon plugins

As of now, when horizon plugins are configured in the horizon repo,
pep8 and docs tox env cannot run.
This is because openstack_dashboard.settings tries to load horizon plugins
but horizon plugins are not installed in tox env by default and
the jobs will fail as a result.
This commit changes to use openstack_dashboard.test.settings
as DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE for these tox environments by default.

Change-Id: I6a9d0c74271cc4addd8a0964b5955d7d3b6d8267

[{'created': '2018-12-18 14:57:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix ceilometerdb-size validation

Ceilometer doesn't deal with metrics database anymore and Gnocchi doesn't have
interesting parameters to check according to this validation. We can only check
the 'event_ttl_check' in the panko configuration file which crontols the number
of seconds that an event is kept in the database. We also have to note that
panko won't exist anymore in the Stein release.

This patch simplifies this validation.

Change-Id: I2c655cacb748596068d5cfb7cb89eb33ac5cdbbe
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometerdb-size validation

Ceilometer doesn't deal with metrics database anymore and Gnocchi doesn't have
interesting parameters to check according to this validation. We can only check
the 'event_ttl_check' in the panko configuration file which crontols the number
of seconds that an event is kept in the database. We also have to note that
panko won't exist anymore in the Stein release.

This patch simplifies this validation.

Change-Id: I2c655cacb748596068d5cfb7cb89eb33ac5cdbbe
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Improve the openshift-nw-openstack validation

This validation should be executed only if an overcloud has been deployed and
working. This patch tests if an overcloud is present and if it's not the case
the validation will succeed with a warning.

Change-Id: I366238859c27d07df4b50a9c0b94400a4731817f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Trove cluster capacity autoscaling example

In response to low disk capacity on any cluster nodes an alarm is
raised on the whole cluster and Mistral workflow is triggered to
scale cluster capacity up.

Change-Id: Ie013b44199816fe2b65d0ebfc9b95f7b5324f863
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

subject: fix checking if enforcer was loaded
messages:
[{'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-19 16:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-19 16:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-19 16:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-20 08:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

In addition to my inline comments, unit tests for this change is required.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 09:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-20 10:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

temporary -1. I believe the current behavior is the expected behavior when we introduced policy_dirs support [1]. The current horizon assumes policy_files are properly configured and available services are determined based on 
. Is there a case where a file specified in POLICY_FILES does not exist but POLICY_DIRS files need to be loaded.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/configuration/settings.html#policy-dirs'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-20 10:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The sentence above was not complete. The complete version is:

--

temporary -1. I believe the current behavior is the expected behavior when we introduced policy_dirs support [1]. The current horizon assumes policy_files are properly configured and available services are determined based on POLICY_FILES. Is there a case where a file specified in POLICY_FILES does not exist but POLICY_DIRS files need to be loaded?'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-20 12:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(4 comments)

this patch fixes the behavior that horizon fails with traceback in case of a misconfigured file, this misconfiguration also breaks the first page load after restart.

Also `os.path.isfile()` does not like `None` as param. So this patch also corrects that breakage when the file is not found by checking for rules in a policy, independent of where they were found (policy_file, policy_dirs)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-22 15:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

I understand your intention to avoid traceback.
I still think it is worth emitting a warning when a corresponding policy file does not exist and it can be done by checking enforcer.policy_file is not None.
However, there is no special magic to check all polily files (i.e., policy.json and files under policy_dirs), so I think this is an acceptable compromise.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2018-11-27 13:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-12-03 11:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-12-03 11:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

rebased'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-12-06 10:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

is anything pending here ?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-09 16:55:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

I don't know why my last vote was lost during rebase regardless of that there is no change......"}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2018-12-10 21:45:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I appreciate your efforts to improve the error handling here. I do think there are a couple of changes needed to improve the accuracy.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-12 09:43:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

David's comments make sense to me."}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-12-14 13:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-12-14 13:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2018-12-14 21:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-22 13:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-22 13:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2018-12-22 19:10:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Sure that works for me, I guess I wasn't understanding that the policy file was a full path already as output. Thanks for bearing with me."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-22 21:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

>  I guess I wasn't understanding that the policy file was a full path already as output.

the policy path is not necessarily a full path.
The latest patch set ensures to expand it to a full path."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-22 21:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 16:08:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix checking if enforcer was loaded

enforcer for policy can be loaded from a single file or from multiple
files (policy_dir). so checking for policy_file is not good enough.

If a policy is loaded it will have some rules, if not oslo_policy
rejects all acccess. So checking for existance of rules is a better
check.

Some refactoring for better logging

Change-Id: Id1f65058014ef5b14449b502d6741da9d34767b3
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 16:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'fix checking if enforcer was loaded

enforcer for policy can be loaded from a single file or from multiple
files (policy_dir). so checking for policy_file is not good enough.

If a policy is loaded it will have some rules, if not oslo_policy
rejects all acccess, but it is not saved to the _ENFORCER object.
So checking for existance of rules is a better check.

Some refactoring for better logging

Change-Id: Id1f65058014ef5b14449b502d6741da9d34767b3
'}, {'created': '2018-11-19 16:11:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix checking if enforcer was loaded

enforcer for policy can be loaded from a single file or from multiple
files (policy_dir). so checking for policy_file is not good enough.

If a policy is loaded it will have some rules, if not oslo_policy
rejects all acccess, but it is not saved to the _ENFORCER object.
So checking for existance of rules is a better check.

Some refactoring for better logging

Change-Id: Id1f65058014ef5b14449b502d6741da9d34767b3
'}, {'created': '2018-11-20 09:12:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix checking if enforcer was loaded

enforcer for policy can be loaded from a single file or from multiple
files (policy_dir). so checking for policy_file is not good enough.

If a policy is loaded it will have some rules, if not loaded then,
oslo_policy rejects all acccess, but it is not saved to the
_ENFORCER object, which is holds the objects used for enforcing

commit_message:
fix checking if enforcer was loaded

enforcer for policy can be loaded from a single file or from multiple
files (policy_dir). so checking for policy_file is not good enough.

If a policy is loaded it will have some rules, if not loaded then,
oslo_policy rejects all acccess, but it is not saved to the
_ENFORCER object, which is holds the objects used for enforcing
policies. So checking for existance of rules is a better check.

Some refactoring for better logging
added tests: test_nonexisting_policy_file_load

Change-Id: Id1f65058014ef5b14449b502d6741da9d34767b3
Closes-Bug: 1804174

commit_message:
Making sure all the pods reside on the same node for port_pool

In order to check the correct behaviour of ports_pool feature,
we must make sure all the podes are created on the same node

Change-Id: I6bfe27b05c52343b8e11e127dc5c87382f215c5e

commit_message:
Remove octavia in favor of octavia-tempest-plugin

Since octavia already has octavia-tempest-plugin and the tempest
plugin does not depends on octavia repo so removing it from there.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554611/ added the list of tempest
plugins for all services but it does not provides info why it was
added in the first place.

Change-Id: I54488290fadb5b70943cfc51669c9588b4586291

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 14:05:45.000000000', 'message': 'Correct failure when stopping cluster state is ignored

If the user passes in the `galera_ignore_cluster_state=true` flag, like
in the case of a node addition or a rolling replacement of nodes,
this role will fail to execute on all new nodes due to the existance of
a functioning cluster galera cluster. The first task in the pre-upgrade
steps attempts to stop the mysql service prior to running anything else.

In this patch we change the task flow to evaluate whether a service
exists, and if it does then to stop it - otherwise skip that task. This
ensures that if `galera_ignore_cluster_state=true` is passed through, the
playbook will run successfully.

Backport note:
This is a combined backport of https://review.openstack.org/607071 and
https://review.openstack.org/625929

Change-Id: Ib26c807057b9114e02ad32c759a5028555788363
(cherry picked from commit 69e2c736a07edc24ed1335bbf4d1a554a39fc40d)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct failure when stopping cluster state is ignored

If the user passes in the `galera_ignore_cluster_state=true` flag, like
in the case of a node addition or a rolling replacement of nodes,
this role will fail to execute on all new nodes due to the existance of
a functioning cluster galera cluster. The first task in the pre-upgrade
steps attempts to stop the mysql service prior to running anything else.

In this patch we change the task flow to evaluate whether a service
exists, and if it does then to stop it - otherwise skip that task. This
ensures that if `galera_ignore_cluster_state=true` is passed through, the
playbook will run successfully.

Backport note:
This is a combined backport of https://review.openstack.org/607071 and
https://review.openstack.org/625929

Change-Id: Ib26c807057b9114e02ad32c759a5028555788363
(cherry picked from commit 69e2c736a07edc24ed1335bbf4d1a554a39fc40d)

commit_message:
[DNM] [CEPH] Journal automation race fix

Introduce a random 30s pause during init so that multiple journal
partitions are not made at the same time. This prevents a race
condition in which OSDs will fail to initialize during new site
deployments.

Change-Id: I8e8700b01502c9178dac8298df1f8a17808f804d

It allows to use troveclient with multi-domain openstack
installation.
These parameters are defined only for the
`keystoneauth1.identity.generic.password.Password`
origin (self.api.client.auth).
`troveclient.client.SessionClient` (self.api.client) doesn't
have domain-specific parameters, so I set these params to `None`,
the value by default.

Change-Id: I5de097f790c71da612f99abb6cc9e676ce1af523
Closes-Bug: #1809541
"}]
commit_message:
forward *_domain_name auth params to mistralclient

It allows to use troveclient with multi-domain openstack
installation.
These parameters are defined only for the
`keystoneauth1.identity.generic.password.Password`
origin (self.api.client.auth).
`troveclient.client.SessionClient` (self.api.client) doesn't
have domain-specific parameters, so I set these params to `None`,
the value by default.

Change-Id: I5de097f790c71da612f99abb6cc9e676ce1af523
Closes-Bug: #1809541

commit_message:
docker: check if ftype exists

When deploying with --stack-only, the playbooks aren't executed so if a
variable is processed lated, it needs to be checked if it's actually
defined or not otherwise Ansible will fail.

Change-Id: I16a2eed003b8f7fd4c775cdeead3f3b51f8aa467

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I20ff1e06909379fd0a0c0fb9fd1136642af1566d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I20ff1e06909379fd0a0c0fb9fd1136642af1566d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Add patchset option to compare-reviews

With this you can specify the specific patchset to compare with syntax
like ./compare-reviews.py 560445/165 610475.

commit_message:
Avoid insecure umask which breaks loading of ansible.cfg

Ansible had a security fix which now prevents it from loading
ansible.cfg files that are world writable (o+w) which is exactly what
the old jobs did in order to make devstack work with hardlinks across
multiple users.

We replace the hardlinks with CoW and reset the permissions to system
default which is what is to be expected for source code.

Change-Id: Ia1bfc89ee8edecd1ebad3487e8c63bdda4d083a0
Partial-Bug: 1807703

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 17:56:40.000000000', 'message': "Remove convert_unicode flag

This flag is to be deprecated in SQLAlchemy version 1.3,
as it is a leftover from the pre-Python 3 legacy days when
DBAPIs under Python 2 would crash if you passed them a
u'' object.   While still available in 1.3, it will emit a
deprecation warning, so it's time to stop using this flag and to
locate any downstream Openstack projects that might be relying
on its behavior in a Python 2 context; the flag has no real effect
on Python 3.

Change-Id: I01984b4ff7e03dcf91ef8dcb05da67dda8270ae3
References: https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/4393
"}]
commit_message:
Remove convert_unicode flag

This flag is to be deprecated in SQLAlchemy version 1.3,
as it is a leftover from the pre-Python 3 legacy days when
DBAPIs under Python 2 would crash if you passed them a
u'' object.   While still available in 1.3, it will emit a
deprecation warning, so it's time to stop using this flag and to
locate any downstream Openstack projects that might be relying
on its behavior in a Python 2 context; the flag has no real effect
on Python 3.

Change-Id: I01984b4ff7e03dcf91ef8dcb05da67dda8270ae3
References: https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/issues/4393

Access to neutron.db.api's context manager is already in neutron-lib
and in fact neutron is already using it as a shim. This patch switches
over context manager access to use neutron-lib's accessors.

Change-Id: Ibb03ad05618f549f3d1088e270214c2d2089c492
"}]
commit_message:
use context manager from neutron-lib

Access to neutron.db.api's context manager is already in neutron-lib
and in fact neutron is already using it as a shim. This patch switches
over context manager access to use neutron-lib's accessors.
Also see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613122

Change-Id: Ibb03ad05618f549f3d1088e270214c2d2089c492

commit_message:
Enhance Trunk port scenarios to create multiple trunks

Earlier it was only possible to create one trunk port with multiple
subports. This commits adds capability to specify number of trunks each
with some subports.

Change-Id: Icc23fd28dab617d841f2b1aff6cc813e4c869290

ci related to podman :(

https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844

[{'account_id': 16881, 'date': '2018-06-11 22:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-11 22:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 16881, 'date': '2018-06-11 22:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-06-11 23:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 22:37:22.000000000', 'message': ' Implements: bp/port-mirroring-sriov-vf
 Author: Munish Mehan

 Add SRIOV mirroring support to Tap as a Service.
   Allows Vlans to VF mirror.
   Allows VF to VF mirror.
   Allows PF to VF mirror.

 Implements new tap agent for sriov and driver for Intel i40e nic.

Change-Id: If2e4e2bf70f11ab0136482cb86acad3a3eded649

commit_message:
Introduce port mirroring for sriov-vf

 Add SRIOV mirroring support to Tap as a Service.
   Allows Vlans to VF mirror.
   Allows VF to VF mirror.

 Spec for new tap agent for sriov and driver for Intel i40e nic.
 Added the two implementation approaches to API.

Change-Id: If2e4e2bf70f11ab0136482cb86acad3a3eded649

commit_message:
Remove dependencies from kolla ansible jobs

These are no longer required, since the jobs in kolla-ansible define
kolla-ansible as a required project.

Change-Id: I9953159237580167b20a7aebf0125efaadef928c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/625874

commit_message:
Add contrib/ dir to setup.cfg

contrib directory contains ovs-dpdk.j2 template override, but
exists only in git repository - not in the pip package contents.

Change-Id: Ic034331032810a2003a328b82492c6fd56ddd85f
Closes-Bug: #1808302
(cherry picked from commit a8eafa803441d67547d939951deae7b71dc9ae7b)

commit_message:
[Core] Fix links of delorean part.

The links of delorean part is broken. The links pointed on liberty
release but this one is now unmaintained by the community. So all
links have a 404 error.

Change-Id: I1fe8b6434fc57d3eea4fe957529fd5aae073ea5b
Closes-Bug: #1803549

commit_message:
In case of an error, always add message

The Jaeger driver counts on this message to be in the error description.
It fails if the message is not present

Closes-Bug: 1804218
Change-Id: I08f8328700049d9a0d791b12375fe9a6e8a3948a

subject: Clarify location for HTTPD instructions
messages:
[{'account_id': 29378, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:12:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hi Maria, thanks for your first contribution!!!

Welcome to the community.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-27 01:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Welcome, Maria. A nit in the commit message. Otherwise looks good.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-10-27 01:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-31 10:41:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Maria, thanks for the contribution. You can address wangxiyuan's feedback by doing `git commit --amend` and adding the closes-bug tag to the commit message, then running `git review` again. When you've done that I can approve this patch."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-12-21 23:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-12-21 23:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Maria, since you haven't been back to address the reviewer feedback I went ahead and updated the patch for you. Thanks for getting it started!"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-12-22 02:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Replace zaqar image with zaqar-wsgi image

Since kolla change Ic356fb81c19ebbc78aa3c7e871c4946d1f712a45 there are
now 2 zaqar images, and we only need the WSGI one.

Change-Id: I26e3aca0641d093857da5da5e88da004ff4e1576
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1808349

commit_message:
Fix the link to the Placement API Version History

The Placement REST API Version History page has been
created by splitting the Placement doc top page (index.html)
since I66e0c7d18b253b0a5a8fdac65e30b5b3cef37db2.

So the link to the Placement REST API Version History
is updated in the nova doc.

Change-Id: I60701b09ade203b35d4d1281eb32b177543c064a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 04:34:57.000000000', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I7f2bc476d0be7994feef781cb254c8b0c53b8b5b
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I7f2bc476d0be7994feef781cb254c8b0c53b8b5b

commit_message:
Bypass standalone container prep at mixed OSs

It's not possible to update centos images with fedora repos, so we have
to bypass this step, also this mixed OSs stuff it's temporary so let's
not spend time here.


Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/509?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: I7026c747083a195246a00a3513a4c69c32569468

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 17:46:30.000000000', 'message': "Run pcs command only if the pacemaker service is active

This patch checks first if the pacemaker service is active on the Controller
before to run 'pcs status xml' command. This will avoid the validation to fail
miserably on a non-HA deployment.

Change-Id: I10e5d11f929f3b0fce02d5e82437aca9d35cf271
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 216788c32062f245882c878d8e0f12d9d9cdc4d7)
"}]
commit_message:
Run pcs command only if the pacemaker service is active

This patch checks first if the pacemaker service is active on the Controller
before to run 'pcs status xml' command. This will avoid the validation to fail
miserably on a non-HA deployment.

Change-Id: I10e5d11f929f3b0fce02d5e82437aca9d35cf271
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 216788c32062f245882c878d8e0f12d9d9cdc4d7)

commit_message:
More volume functional test fixes

Remove the use of class setup/teardown from volume transfer functional tests
as that just doesn't work too well here. Also wait for volume status before
attempting transfer request operations, some test nodes take a while to
create the volumes.

Change-Id: Ib9378ab5c973deb2aa86c9b9ed31408f3a05115a
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

in doc/source/user/cells.rst.

commit_message:
Remove reproducer lines added to get zuul related info

zuul_variables and zuul_console were added when there
was an investigation into simulating zuul behavior
for the reproducer. We are no longer following that
workflow for the reproducer and therefore these
failing lines can be removed.

Change-Id: I5f057ce78273ddf8cd6381c9a420b317713379b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 22:42:39.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Reenable health policy tests

Change-Id: If34be5d01fc9e58d548f68e85b691d3ed7bd4c51
'}, {'created': '2018-12-04 20:05:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health policy tests

- Change clustering client delete and trigger_action to use request
  method instead of delete or post directly.  This way exceptions will
  be propagated.
- Modified clustering client wait_for_status to accept list of expected
  statuses.
- Use tenacity to retry delete cluster and detach policy calls if it
  returns Conflict because of locked cluster.
- Wait for action status to become SUCCEEDED or FAILED when calling
  delete cluster or detach policy.
- Use custom detach policy as cleanup action so that it waits for 5
  seconds to allow the health manager to stop health check threads

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618907/
Closes-Bug: bug/1797270
Change-Id: If34be5d01fc9e58d548f68e85b691d3ed7bd4c51
'}, {'created': '2018-12-04 20:27:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health policy tests

- Use separate prepare_and_cleanup_nova_server function call for
  nova_server_cluster test and health_policy tests to avoid race
  condition between the tests.
- Make list of dictionary keys before indexing (need for python 3)

- Use custom detach policy as cleanup action so that it waits for 5
  seconds to allow the health manager to stop health check threads
- Use separate prepare_and_cleanup_nova_server function call for
  nova_server_cluster test and health_policy tests to avoid race
  condition between the tests.
- Make list of dictionary keys before indexing (need for python 3)

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624248/
Closes-Bug: 1797270
Change-Id: If34be5d01fc9e58d548f68e85b691d3ed7bd4c51
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health policy tests

- Change clustering client delete and trigger_action to use request
  method instead of delete or post directly.  This way exceptions will
  be propagated.
- Modified clustering client wait_for_status to accept list of expected
  statuses.
- Use tenacity to retry delete cluster and detach policy calls if it
  returns Conflict because of locked cluster.
- Wait for action status to become SUCCEEDED or FAILED when calling
  delete cluster or detach policy.
- Use custom detach policy as cleanup action so that it waits for 5
  seconds to allow the health manager to stop health check threads
- Use separate prepare_and_cleanup_nova_server function call for
  nova_server_cluster test and health_policy tests to avoid race
  condition between the tests.
- Make list of dictionary keys before indexing (need for python 3)

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624248/
Closes-Bug: 1797270
Change-Id: If34be5d01fc9e58d548f68e85b691d3ed7bd4c51

commit_message:
Temporary remove selinux label mount option for neutron

Neutron services failing with below Error when running
with podman(0.12.1) and container-selinux(2.77):-

relabel failed "/run/netns": operation not supported

Until this is fixed in podman/container-selinux, temporary
remove selinux relabel on /run/netns.


Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626546/
Change-Id: Iedbeac17a0c530ecdc7e8cbba5ddd4ffb22bb616
Partial-Bug: #1809218

commit_message:
Retire undercloud_conf custom plugin

The 'undercloud_conf' custom plugin is buggy and has been replaced by the 'ini'
plugin on the each validations which was using the 'undercloud.conf'.

Change-Id: Id5bbbcc5bcf1fe247169c22504f4840f3403de09
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Handle loadbalancer SGs are created when sg_mode is create

This patch set ensures the loadbalancer SG and its rules are
properly created when the sg_mode is set to create.

In addition, this patch makes posible to enforce network policies
for svc when sg_mode is 'create' and the octavia driver is 'ovn'

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Closes-Bug: 1809451
Change-Id: I776e7d82bb0b3ffed45f084519a3c3180d5e915c

commit_message:
Fix dhcp-provisioning validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's
values from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf'
custom plugin.

Change-Id: Ieb38d974fbe2291a2cd3bb1a9d4df9cd971bd098
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
